"HowToStep", "text": "Set the rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C). (If the parchment is slipping, dot a little butter or nonstick spray in the corners of the pan to help the parchment stick.)", "name": "Set the rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C). Line a 13 x 9 x 2-inch (33 x 22 x 5-cm) pan with parchment paper (bring the parchment up the sides of pan so there is a slight overhang) and grease with butter or nonstick cooking spray. (If the parchment is slipping, dot a little butter or nonstick spray in the corners of the pan to help the parchment stick.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/brookies.html#wprm-recipe-74477-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the brownie batter: Place the butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl and melt in the microwave until bubbling. Add the chocolate and whisk until the chocolate is completely melted. The heat from the butter should be enough to melt the chocolate completely, but if not, place the chocolate-butter mixture in the microwave and heat for 20 seconds or so, then whisk again. (Alternatively, combine the butter and chocolate in a heatproof bowl and set over a pan of simmering water. Stir occasionally until melted.) Whisk in the granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and salt. The mixture will be a bit grainy; that's okay. Whisk in the eggs. Finally, whisk in the flour until combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Set aside.", "name": "Make the brownie batter: Place the butter in a medium microwave-safe bowl and melt in the microwave until bubbling. Add the chocolate and whisk until the chocolate is completely melted. The heat from the butter should be enough to melt the chocolate completely, but if not, place the chocolate-butter mixture in the microwave and heat for 20 seconds or so, then whisk again. (Alternatively, combine the butter and chocolate in a heatproof bowl and set over a pan of simmering water. Stir occasionally until melted.) Whisk in the granulated sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and salt. The mixture will be a bit grainy; that's okay. Whisk in the eggs. Finally, whisk in the flour until combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly with a spatula. "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706878613991", "name": "Can I make this fondue on the stovetop?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, you can easily adapt microwave chocolate fondue for the stovetop. Use a double boiler or make your own by placing a heatproof bowl over a pot of simmering water. Ensure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Add all of the ingredients to the double boiler and stir until the chocolate melts smoothly. This method allows for more control over the temperature, reducing the risk of overheating the chocolate.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706745098844", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706745098844", "name": "How should I store and reheat leftover fondue?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Leftover fondue can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up 4 days. To reheat, transfer the fondue to a microwave-safe bowl and heat it in short, 15-second intervals, stirring between each interval to ensure even heating. Alternatively, you can reheat the fondue on the stovetop using a double boiler or a similar setup to gently melt the chocolate. Reheat only the amount you plan to use, as repeated reheating may affect the fondue's texture.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706878896166", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706878896166", "name": "Why is it important to heat chocolate gently?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Chocolate is sensitive to high temperatures, which can cause it to burn, seize, or become grainy. When chocolate is heated too quickly or over too high a temperature, the cocoa butter can separate from the solids. Gently heating chocolate, either in short intervals in the microwave or over a double boiler on the stovetop, ensures that it melts evenly and retains a smooth, silky consistency.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706879571867", "position": 4, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-fondue.html#faq-question-1706879571867", "name": "I don't have a fondue pot. How should I serve the fondue?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "If you don't have a fondue pot, you can serve the fondue in a ceramic or glass bowl. It will stay \"dippable\" for a while, and you can rewarm it in short-bursts in the microwave if necessary. A small slow cooker set on low will also keep the fondue warm and smooth; just be sure to stir it occasionally. "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "557", "fatContent": "41 g", "carbohydrateContent": "11 g", "proteinContent": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the lower-middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sheet-pan-blackened-salmon-with-garlicky-kale.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the Salmon: In a small bowl, combine the paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, dry mustard, oregano, and \u00be teaspoon salt; stir until evenly mixed and no lumps remain. Use 1 tablespoon of the oil to grease a rimmed sheet pan. Place the salmon filets, skin-side down, on the pan, leaving space between them; drizzle the salmon with 2 tablespoons of the oil. Sprinkle the spice mix evenly over the salmon. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sheet-pan-blackened-salmon-with-garlicky-kale.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the Kale: In a medium bowl, using tongs, toss the kale with the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil, the minced garlic, and a pinch of salt. Arrange it all around (but not covering) the salmon; it's okay to pile it up a bit, as it will shrink significantly as it roasts.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/sheet-pan-blackened-salmon-with-garlicky-kale.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the pan on the lower-middle rack and roast for 12 to 14 minutes for medium-cooked salmon. (If you prefer your salmon medium-rare, cook 10 to 12 minutes. For well-done, cook 15 to 17 minutes.) Remove the pan from the oven and drizzle the honey over the fish. Then sprinkle the lime zest and juice over the fish. Serve immediately. The soup may thicken during storage, so add a bit of water or chicken broth to thin it out while reheating, if necessary. {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-18689", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Easy Chocolate Fudge Recipe", "description": "All the rich, melt-in-your-mouth magic of old-fashioned chocolate fudge\u2014without the fuss.", "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT5M", "totalTime": "PT15M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 square", "calories": "72", "fatContent": "4 g", "carbohydrateContent": "8 g", "proteinContent": "1 g", "saturatedFatContent": "2 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "7 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "23 mg", "cholesterolContent": "2 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line an 8-inch square baking dish with aluminum foil, pushing the foil neatly into the corners and up the sides of the pan, using two pieces if necessary to ensure that the foil overlaps all edges (the overhang will help removal from the pan). Spray the foil with nonstick cooking spray. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/15-minute-chocolate-walnut-fudge.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the chocolates, baking soda, and salt in a medium heatproof bowl until baking soda is evenly distributed. Stir in sweetened condensed milk and vanilla. Set the bowl over a 4-quart saucepan containing 2 cups of simmering water. Stir with a rubber spatula until the chocolate is almost fully melted and just a few small pieces remain, 2 to 4 minutes. (Make sure to remove the fudge from the double boiler before the chocolate is fully melted. If the chocolate stays in the double boiler too long, there is the possibility of the chocolate separating and producing a greasy fudge.) ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/15-minute-chocolate-walnut-fudge.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the bowl from the heat and continue to stir until the chocolate is fully melted and the mixture is smooth, about 2 minutes. Stir in the walnuts. Transfer the fudge to the prepared pan and spread into an even layer with the spatula. Refrigerate until set, about 2 hours. Remove the fudge from the pan using the foil overhang and cut into squares. Store the fudge, tightly wrapped in plastic, in a cool place for up to 2 weeks.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/15-minute-chocolate-walnut-fudge.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To Make a Double Batch: Line a 13 by 9-inch pan; double amounts of all the ingredients; and use a large heatproof bowl and Dutch oven containing 4 cups of simmering water for melting the fudge mixture.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/15-minute-chocolate-walnut-fudge.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The fudge can be frozen for up to 3 months. If frozen, allow ample time to let it reach room temperature before cutting. The fudge will change texture and become drier the longer it is frozen. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/15-minute-chocolate-walnut-fudge.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}], "recipeIngredient": ["16 ounces  semisweet chocolate, best quality such as Ghirardelli, coarsely chopped", "2 ounces  unsweetened chocolate, best quality such as Ghirardelli, coarsely chopped", "\u00bd teaspoon  baking soda ", "\u215b teaspoon salt ", "1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk ", "1 tablespoon vanilla extract", "1 cup  coarsely chopped walnuts  "], "recipeYield": "{2\u00bd pounds|1.1 kg} (36-64 squares, depending on how large you cut them)", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/02/Chocolate-Walnut-Fudge-2-1200x841.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/02/Chocolate-Walnut-Fudge-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/02/Chocolate-Walnut-Fudge-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/02/Chocolate-Walnut-Fudge-2-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from\u00a0<span class=\"s2\"><a href=\"http://cooks.io/2kGvPgA\">Cook\u2019s Illustrated</a>", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.96, "ratingCount": "27"}, "datePublished": "2017-02-13T11:30:36-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Chocolate, Christmas, For the Host/Hostess, Halloween, Nuts, Passover, Sweetened Condensed Milk, Valentine's Day", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Place the potatoes directly on the oven rack (alternatively, you can place them on a wire rack set in a rimmed baking sheet). Bake until very soft, 50 to 60 minutes, depending on the size of the potatoes. (Err on the side of overcooking rather than undercooking them.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the potatoes from the oven. While they are still hot, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Using an oven mitt or a folded kitchen towel to hold the hot potatoes, scoop out all of the flesh from each potato half into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (*see note below on using a potato ricer, food mill or hand-held electric mixer). The flesh near the skin gets a little tough, so be sure to leave it behind. Break the cooked potato flesh down into small pieces using a potato masher, fork, or rubber spatula. Beat on low speed until completely smooth and no lumps remain, 1 to 2 minutes, stopping the mixer to scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. (Note: it\u2019s important to mash the potatoes while they are still hot, otherwise you\u2019ll end up with lumps.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, bring the cream and 6 tablespoons of the butter to a simmer. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the bowl from the mixer stand and, using a large rubber spatula, gradually fold in the hot cream and butter mixture. It will take a few minutes to mix it all in; keep folding until the potatoes are smooth and creamy. Stir in the salt, then taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a large microwave-safe bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap (the bowl should be large enough that the potatoes don\u2019t touch the plastic wrap). Refrigerate for up to 2 days. (DO NOT FREEZE)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To reheat, use the tip of a knife to poke about 10 holes in the plastic wrap, and microwave at medium-high (75 percent) power until the potatoes are hot, about 14 minutes, stirring halfway through the reheating time. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a serving dish, top with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, and sprinkle with the chives. Serve hot.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Notes: For perfectly smooth potatoes, pass the potato flesh through a potato ricer or food mill before adding them to the mixer. If you don't have a stand mixer, you can use a hand-held electric mixer. If you don't have an electric mixer, pass the potatoes through a food mill or potato ricer and then whip by hand with a wooden spoon.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Oven-Reheating Instructions: If you\u2019d prefer to reheat the potatoes in the oven, transfer them to an oven-safe dish, cover tightly with foil, and bake in a 350\u00b0F oven for 30 to 40 minutes, stirring halfway through to ensure they heat evenly.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3\u00bd pounds  Russet potatoes", "2 cups  heavy cream", "8 tablespoons  unsalted butter, divided", "1\u00bd teaspoons  salt", " Chives, for serving"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-1200x1572.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from Cooks Illustrated", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.79, "ratingCount": "513"}, "datePublished": "2017-11-14T16:06:07-05:00", "keywords": "Christmas, Comfort Food, Fall, Potatoes, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Turn the burgers over; continue to cook until the bottom side is light brown but not yet crusted, about 3 minutes longer. Transfer the pan to the oven and continue cooking for 7 to 8 minutes, or until the burgers are completely cooked (an instant-read thermometer inserted from the side of the burger into the center should register 160\u00b0F). Using moistened hands, roll into 1 or 1\u00bd-inch (2.5 to 4-cm) meatballs (depending on whether you&#39;re serving them as an appetizer or for dinner) and space evenly apart on the prepared baking sheet. Using a spoon, dollop the warm batter over the cheesecake layer, about 8 dollops (for the prettiest marble effect, leave as much space as possible between the dollops). "name": "Grilled Cheese Sandwiches with Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto", "description": "What do you get when you combine a classic American grilled cheese with Italian sun-dried tomato pesto? A deliciously crispy and gooey sandwich that delivers bold and tangy \"pizza\" flavor.", "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 sandwich", "calories": "646", "fatContent": "54 g", "carbohydrateContent": "21 g", "proteinContent": "20 g", "saturatedFatContent": "22 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "2 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "733 mg", "cholesterolContent": "98 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade, combine the sun-dried tomatoes with their oil, garlic, salt, red pepper flakes, sugar, basil, pine nuts, Parmigiano-Reggiano and 2 tablespoons of water. Pulse, scraping down the sides as necessary, until the mixture is finely pur\u00e9ed.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grilled-cheese-sun-dried-tomato-pesto.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread one side of each slice of bread with butter, then flip over and spread the pesto evenly over the other side of each slice. Heat a large nonstick or cast iron pan over medium heat. Place 4 slices of bread, butter-side-down, in the pan. Divide the cheese evenly over the bread, then top the sandwiches with the remaining bread. Cook until the first side is golden brown, a few minutes. Carefully flip the sandwiches and cook until the cheese is fully melted and the bread is golden brown, a few minutes more. Let cool slightly, then slice the sandwiches in half and serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grilled-cheese-sun-dried-tomato-pesto.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: You'll have plenty of leftover sun-dried tomato pesto. It keeps well in the refrigerator for up to 4 days and can be frozen for up to 2 months. "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-18733", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal, adapted from Betsy Goldstein's recipe "}, "name": "Shrimp Saganaki (Greek ", "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT50M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "431", "fatContent": "25g", "carbohydrateContent": "21g", "proteinContent": "32g", "saturatedFatContent": "9g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "14g", "fiberContent": "5g", "sodiumContent": "1379mg", "cholesterolContent": "252mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 400\u00b0F; set one oven rack in the middle position and another about 5 inches underneath the broiler.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/greek-shrimp-saganaki.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the olive oil in a wide oven-proof skillet (see note) over medium-low heat. Add the shallots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. Do not brown.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/greek-shrimp-saganaki.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the tomatoes with their juices, salt, pepper, cumin, red pepper flakes, and honey. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thickened, 15 to 20 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/greek-shrimp-saganaki.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Off the heat, arrange the shrimp over the tomato sauce in an even layer. Crumble the feta over the shrimp, and then sprinkle with the oregano. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, until the shrimp are pink and just cooked (the cooking time will depend on the size of the shrimp). Turn on the broiler. Using an oven mitt, carefully transfer the pan to the higher oven rack and broil for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the feta is golden brown in spots. Using an oven mitt, remove the pan from the oven (and immediately place the oven mitt or a dishtowel over the handle of the pan because it's very easy to forget that it is burning hot). Let the shrimp rest for 5 minutes, then sprinkle with mint and serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/greek-shrimp-saganaki.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you do not have an oven-proof skillet, simply transfer the tomato sauce to a 9-by-13-inch or equivalent broiler-safe baking dish and proceed from there.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/greek-shrimp-saganaki.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bc cup extra-virgin olive oil", "\u00be cup finely chopped shallots, from about 3 shallots", "4 garlic cloves, roughly chopped", "1  (28-oz) can diced tomatoes", "1\u00bd teaspoons salt", "\u00bc teaspoon pepper", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "\u00bd teaspoon  crushed red pepper flakes (use less if you are heat-sensitive)", "1 tablespoon honey", "1\u00bd pounds extra large shrimp (26/30), peeled and deveined, thawed if frozen", "6 ounces feta cheese", "\u00be teaspoon  dried oregano", "2 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh mint"], "recipeYield": "4", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/03/Baked-Shrimp-with-Feta-2-1200x905.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/03/Baked-Shrimp-with-Feta-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/03/Baked-Shrimp-with-Feta-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/03/Baked-Shrimp-with-Feta-2-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.9, "ratingCount": "401"}, "datePublished": "2017-03-08T08:43:50-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Cookbook 2 Recipe, Feta, Honey, Shrimp, Tomatoes", "recipeCuisine": "Greek", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00b0F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/snickerdoodles.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/snickerdoodles.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter with 1\u00bd cups of the sugar until smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the eggs and beat until combined. Add the flour mixture and mix on low speed until the dough comes together. Using your hands, gather the dough into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap (dust your hands with flour if the dough is sticky); refrigerate until firm, at least 30 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/snickerdoodles.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, mix together the remaining two tablespoons of sugar and the cinnamon. Pinch off tablespoons of dough and shape into 1-inch balls. Roll the balls in the cinnamon-sugar and place on the prepared baking sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake for 8 to 9 minutes, shifting the cookie sheets from top to bottom and front to back halfway through baking. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/snickerdoodles.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> These cookies are best enjoyed fresh on the day they are made. However, the cookies can be reheated briefly in the microwave for that fresh-out-of-the-oven texture. The dough may also be stored in the refrigerator for several days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/snickerdoodles.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<u><strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong></u> The cookie dough can be frozen for up to 3 months: Roll the dough into balls, let set on a baking sheet in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.)  The baked cookies can also be frozen for up to 3 months. Let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the cookies from the container and let them come to room temperature.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/snickerdoodles.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off", "2 teaspoons cream of tartar", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, softened", "1\u00bd cups plus 2 tablespoons sugar, divided", "2 large eggs", "1 tablespoon cinnamon"], "recipeYield": "About 56 cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/11/snickerdoodles-1200x836.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/11/snickerdoodles-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/11/snickerdoodles-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/11/snickerdoodles-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Crispy-Crunchy-Your-Mouth-Cookies-Medrich-ebook/dp/B00DHUERGI/ref=sr_1_1?crid=2IFKW1O44GMT6&dchild=1&keywords=chewy+gooey+crispy+crunchy+by+alice+medrich&qid=1626199844&sprefix=chewy+gooey%2Caps%2C169&sr=8-1\">Chewy Gooey Crispy Crunchy Melt-In-Your-Mouth Cookies</a> by Alice Medrich", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.92, "ratingCount": "74"}, "datePublished": "2021-11-30T09:35:03-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas", "recipeCuisine": "American, German", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"HowToStep", "text": "Make the crust: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a food processor fitted with the steel blade, combine the flour, salt and sugar. Pulse briefly to combine. Add the cold butter and process just until the butter is the size of peas, about 5 seconds. Sprinkle the ice water over the mixture and process just until moistened and very crumbly, about 5 seconds. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead a few times, just until it comes together into a cohesive ball. Pat the dough into a disk. Flour your work surface again and dust the dough with flour, as well. Using a rolling pin, roll into a circle 8 to 10 inches in diameter, turning and adding more flour as necessary so the dough doesn\u2019t stick. Transfer the dough to the parchment-lined baking sheet and refrigerate while you prepare the filling (you\u2019ll roll the dough out further on the parchment paper so go ahead and clean your work surface).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Filling: Peel, core, and cut the apples into \u215b-inch-thick slices (you should have about 4 cups) and place in a large bowl. Add the sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, melted butter, and salt; toss to combine. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough from the fridge and slide the parchment paper onto the countertop. Roll the dough, directly on the parchment paper, into a 14-inch circle about \u215b inch thick. It\u2019s fine if the edges are a little ragged. Place the parchment and dough back on the baking sheet \u2013 the pastry should curve up the lip of the pan. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Assemble the tart: Sprinkle the flour evenly over the pastry. Arrange the apple slices on top in overlapping concentric circles to within 3 inches of the edge. Don\u2019t worry about making it look perfect! It doesn\u2019t make much difference in the end and you don\u2019t want the dough to get too warm. Fold the edges of the dough over the apples in a free-form fashion, working your way around and creating pleats as you go. Patch up any tears by pinching a bit of dough from the edge. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a pastry brush, brush the pleated dough evenly with the beaten egg. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the turbinado sugar over the top crust and 1 tablespoon over the fruit. Chill the assembled tart in the fridge for 15 to 20 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the center position. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 55 to 65 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the crust is golden and cooked through. (It\u2019s okay if some of the juices leak from the tart onto the pan. The juices will burn on the pan but the tart should be fine -- just scrape any burnt bits away from the tart once it\u2019s baked.) Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the tart cools, make the optional glaze. In a small bowl, mix the apricot jam with 1\u00bd teaspoons water. Heat in the microwave until bubbling, about 20 seconds. Using a pastry brush, brush the apples with the apricot syrup. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use two large spatulas to transfer the tart to a serving plate or cutting board. Slice and serve warm or at room temperature. The tart is best served on the day it is made, but leftovers will keep, loosely covered on the countertop, for a few days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Be sure to use baking apples that hold their shape when cooked, such as Honeycrisp, Jonagold, Fuji, Granny Smith, or Golden Delicious. And use a mix of different varietals for the best flavor.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make Ahead:</strong> The dough can be made up to 3 days in advance and refrigerated. Allow it to sit at room temperature for about 15 minutes or until pliable before rolling. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The assembled tart may be frozen for up to 3 months. To freeze, place the baking sheet in the freezer until the tart is frozen, then wrap tightly. (Wait until right before baking the tart to brush the beaten egg and sprinkle the sugar onto the crust.) Bake directly from the freezer. (It may take a few extra minutes to bake from frozen.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rustic-french-apple-tart.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00bd cups all-purpose flour, spooned and leveled  ", "\u00bd teaspoon  salt ", "2 tablespoons granulated sugar  ", "1\u00bd sticks (12 tablespoons)   very cold unsalted butter, cut into \u00bd-inch pieces  ", "\u00bc cup  very cold water ", "1\u00be lbs baking apples (3 large) (see note)", "\u2153 cup  sugar ", "1 teaspoon  vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon  cinnamon", "2 tablespoons  unsalted butter, melted", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "1 tablespoon  all purpose flour", "1  egg, beaten", "2 tablespoons  turbinado sugar", "1 tablespoon apricot jelly or jam, optional for glaze"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/french-apple-tart-1-1200x1800.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/french-apple-tart-1-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/french-apple-tart-1-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/french-apple-tart-1-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.93, "ratingCount": "610"}, "datePublished": "2017-10-25T05:58:31-04:00", "keywords": "Apples, Christmas, Comfort Food, Fall, Jewish Holiday Recipes, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "French", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-35072", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Viennese Crescent Cookies", "description": " "In a medium bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, almond flour, and salt.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/viennese-crescent-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter and granulated sugar until pale and creamy, about 2 minutes. Beat in the vanilla and almond extracts. Add dry the ingredients and mix on low speed until the dough comes together. Cover and chill the dough in the refrigerator for 15 to 20 minutes, or until it's firm enough to be easily handled.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/viennese-crescent-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F and set two oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/viennese-crescent-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For each cookie, use about 2 teaspoons of dough and shape it into a 2-inch long log. Gently bend each log into a crescent shape. (If the dough is crumbly after chilling for more than the recommended time, knead it slightly with your hands to make it more pliable.) Space the crescents about 2 inches apart on your prepared baking sheets. Bake for 12 to 14 minutes, rotating the pans from top to bottom and front to back halfway through baking, until the cookies are pale on top and lightly golden on the bottom. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Using a small fine sieve, dust the cookies all over with confectioners' sugar. (Alternatively, you can gently roll the cookies in the confectioners' sugar until coated.) Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days. Dust the cookies again with confectioners' sugar before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/viennese-crescent-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The cookie dough can be frozen for up to 3 months. Shape the dough into crescents, let set on a baking sheet in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) To freeze the cookies after baking, let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the cookies from the container and let them come to room temperature. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/viennese-crescent-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00be cups  all-purpose flour", "\u2154 cup  finely sifted/super-fine almond flour", "\u00bd teaspoon  salt", "2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, softened", "\u00bc cup + 2 tablespoons  granulated sugar", "\u00bd teaspoon  vanilla extract", "\u215b teaspoon  almond extract", "1 cup  confectioners' sugar, for coating"], "recipeYield": "45 cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/Viennese-Crescent-Cookies-1-2-1200x887.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/Viennese-Crescent-Cookies-1-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/Viennese-Crescent-Cookies-1-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/12/Viennese-Crescent-Cookies-1-2-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"https://www.bettycrocker.com/recipes/viennese-almond-crescents/20a96d57-da12-4bf6-8970-7eac135d2ba5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Betty Crocker</a>", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "1"}, "datePublished": "2023-12-09T09:51:56-05:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Whole carrots are usually fresher and have a more intense, natural sweetness compared to baby carrots. Baby carrots are often shaped from larger, older carrots, which can make them blander and less sweet due to processing. Additionally, baby carrots are typically thinner and may burn or turn mushy when roasted at high temperatures. For best results, stick with whole carrots for roasting and save baby carrots for snacking!", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-carrots-with-thyme.html#faq-question-1727611017658", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-carrots-with-thyme.html#faq-question-1727611017658", "name": "Can I make roasted carrots ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, you can make roasted carrots ahead of time! You can also gently squeeze the tomato half to push out the seeds. Remove the cores and dice the tomatoes, then add it to the bowl with the tomato juices/seeds along with the drained onions and remaining salad ingredients. Toss well. During this time, the vegetables will exude more juice so you'll need to taste and adjust the seasoning with salt, pepper, balsamic vinegar, and more Tabasco before serving, if necessary. Spoon the vegetables and dressing into bowls and serve cold with soup spoons. Add the cookie crumbs to the mixture and pulse very briefly just to mix in. Transfer the ice cream to an ungreased 8x4-inch loaf pan or plastic container large enough to fit the ice cream. Cover and freeze until solid, about 8 hours or overnight. Serve cold or at room temperature.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/wild-rice-salad-with-dried-cranberries-apples-orange-vinaigrette.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: To toast the pecans, preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#faq-question-1706970451649", "name": "How can I make cinnamon-sugar pretzel bites?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "If you prefer a cinnamon sugar topping, omit the coarse salt on top. Brush the pretzel bites with butter after baking and sprinkle generously with cinnamon sugar (\u00bd cup sugar plus \u00be teaspoon cinnamon).", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#faq-question-1706970481099", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#faq-question-1706970481099", "name": "Can I substitute active dry yeast for the instant/rapid-rise yeast?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, you can substitute active dry yeast for instant yeast in equal amounts. Traditionally, active dry yeast required activation in warm water before use, a step known as proofing. However, modern active dry yeast is formulated to be mixed directly into the dough with other dry ingredients, similar to instant yeast. Despite this, doughs made with active dry yeast will take slightly longer to rise compared to those made with instant yeast. Therefore, if you're using active dry yeast, be prepared to allow a bit more time for the dough to rise. To give active dry yeast a little boost, you can dissolve it in the warm milk and butter, let it sit until frothy, about 10 minutes, and then proceed with the recipe.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#faq-question-1706971041883", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#faq-question-1706971041883", "name": "Can the dough be made ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes! After the dough has risen, it can be refrigerated for up to three days or frozen for a few months. Thaw the frozen dough in the refrigerator before using. The dough can be shaped into pretzel bites while still cool, but allow about 30 minutes for the bites to puff up a bit before dipping and baking.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}]}, "HowToStep", "text": "Warm the milk and 2 tablespoons of the butter in the microwave until the butter is just melted, about 90 seconds; do not boil. (Alternatively, warm them in a small saucepan.) Add the brown sugar and stir until dissolved; set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the flour, yeast, and salt. Mix on low speed until well combined, about 1 minute. With the mixer on low, gradually add the warm milk/butter mixture to the bowl. When the dough forms a cohesive mass, switch from the paddle attachment to the dough hook. Knead on medium-low speed until the dough is smooth but still slightly tacky, about 5 minutes. (Alternatively, the dough can be mixed and kneaded by hand.) Shape the dough into a ball, place in a clean, lightly greased bowl, and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, 1 to 2 hours.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a 2-quart baking dish, combine the baking soda with 2\u00bc cups boiling water. Stir until the baking soda is dissolved; set aside and let cool to lukewarm (or cooler). (Before baking, you'll dip the pretzels into the solution, which will give them a rich brown crust and pretzel flavor.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 450\u00b0F and set two oven racks in the centermost positions. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper and spray lightly with nonstick cooking spray.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Punch the dough to deflate it, then turn it out onto a clean work surface. (If the dough feels sticky, you can dust it with a bit of flour as needed.) Shape the dough into a log, then cut into 6 equal pieces; cover with a damp dishtowel so the dough doesn't dry out. One at a time, roll and stretch each piece with the palms of your hands into a 24-inch rope about \u00bd-inch thick, holding the ends and slapping the middle of the rope on the counter as you stretch. Cut each rope crosswise into 1\u00bc-inch pieces. They will shrink a bit as they sit; that's okay.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working in batches, drop the pretzel dough bites into the baking soda solution, swish around, and let each batch sit for about 2 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove the pretzel dough bites from the solution, letting any excess liquid drip off, then arrange the bites on the prepared baking sheets, spacing them about 1\u00bd inches apart. Sprinkle evenly with the coarse salt. Bake until golden, switching the pans from top to bottom and front to back about halfway through cooking, for 8 to 9 minutes; watch the bottoms carefully as they can burn. Repeat with the remaining batches.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter and brush on the baked pretzels. The pretzels are best enjoyed warm out of the oven or fresh on the same day.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Active dry yeast may be used instead of instant yeast, however, the dough will take longer to rise. To give active dry yeast a boost, you can dissolve it in the warm milk and butter, let it sit until frothy, about 10 minutes, and then proceed with the recipe.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you prefer a cinnamon sugar topping, omit the coarse salt. Brush with butter after baking and sprinkle generously with cinnamon sugar (\u00bd cup sugar plus about \u00be teaspoon cinnamon)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead Instructions: After the dough has risen, it can be refrigerated for up to three days or frozen for a few months. Thaw the frozen dough in the refrigerator before using. The dough can be shaped into pretzel bites while still cool, but allow about 30 minutes for the bites to puff up a bit before dipping and baking.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pretzel-bites.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup  milk", "5 tablespoons  unsalted butter, divided ", "3 tablespoons  (packed) light brown sugar", "2\u00bc teaspoons instant/rapid-rise yeast (1 package)", "3 cups  all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off ", "1 teaspoon  fine salt", "\u00bc cup  baking soda ", "About 1 teaspoon  coarse or kosher salt"], "recipeYield": "About 85 pretzel bites", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/03/pretzel-bites-1200x1553.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/03/pretzel-bites-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/03/pretzel-bites-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/03/pretzel-bites-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "15"}, "datePublished": "2024-02-03T09:39:04-05:00", "keywords": "After School Snack, All Seasons, Bar Food, Comfort, Game Day, Yeast", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Just what we need at this time of year.  I never make more than 18 cookies.  I can't imagine how small 28 would be. They still take about 20 minutes in my oven.  I would say they are on the forgiving side.  I also find that if left in the fridge for a bit more than an hour, they are pretty easy to roll.\r\nMany thanks!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Gigi"}, "datePublished": "2025-12-10"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "I had these cookies at the Thanksgiving dinner I was invited to.  They were delicious.  I decided to make them for a vegan potluck next week, only to discover that the recipe included egg whites.  Some of the vegans refuse to eat anything with eggs in it, so I took the plunge and substituted aquafabe (the liquid in canned garbanzo beans) for the egg whites.  To my delight, the cookies came out great.  I think they are very similar to the original recipe!  If anyone is interested, I substituted 6 T for the 3 egg whites. "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat together the peanut butter and butter until evenly combined. Add the confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and salt and beat until well-combined \u2014 the mixture will seem dry and crumbly, and you should be able to knead it like play dough. Add the confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and salt and beat until well-combined \u2014 the mixture will seem dry and crumbly, and you should be able to knead it like play dough. Microwave in 30-second increments, stirring in between, until the mixture is about 75% melted, then remove from the microwave and stir until completely melted and smooth. The residual heat in the bowl should be enough to melt the chocolate completely, but if not, place the bowl back in the microwave and heat for 10 seconds or so, then stir again (it's very important not to overheat chocolate, or it will seize up). (Alternatively, if you don't have a microwave, combine the oil and chocolate in a heat-proof bowl and set over a pan of simmering water. Stir occasionally until melted.) Transfer the melted chocolate to a smaller bowl so that the chocolate is deeper; this makes it much easier to dip.", "name": "In a medium microwave-safe bowl, combine the chocolate and oil. Microwave in 30-second increments, stirring in between, until the mixture is about 75% melted, then remove from the microwave and stir until completely melted and smooth. The residual heat in the bowl should be enough to melt the chocolate completely, but if not, place the bowl back in the microwave and heat for 10 seconds or so, then stir again (it's very important not to overheat chocolate, or it will seize up). (Alternatively, if you don't have a microwave, combine the oil and chocolate in a heat-proof bowl and set over a pan of simmering water. Stir occasionally until melted.) Transfer the melted chocolate to a smaller bowl so that the chocolate is deeper; this makes it much easier to dip.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/buckeyes.html#wprm-recipe-74779-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stick a toothpick into the top center of each peanut butter ball. Dip the balls into the melted chocolate, leaving a circle of peanut butter visible on top. Let the excess chocolate drip off, then return the buckeye to the baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining peanut butter balls and chocolate. Chill the buckeyes until firm, about 30 minutes. Remove the toothpicks and smooth out the hole with your pinky finger. Serve the buckeyes at room temperature or chilled.", "name": "Stick a toothpick into the top center of each peanut butter ball. I have never once had a problem following your recipes for the tee. But this time it was just off for me. Being a Reese's fan I was excited to make these. Perhaps you can help me problem solve? I use a metric scale and your metric measurements for all my cooking. I measured precisely but the batter was way to soft and gooey so I had to keep adding icing sugar until it became more like playdough consistency like you said. Then I had seen another recipe that said if you don't want the flat bottoms than to put them on a wire rack to dry. I should have followed your advice and done the wax paper. "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bd cup heavy cream", "2 tablespoons Baileys Irish Cream ((okay to substitute more heavy cream))", "1 tablespoon unsalted butter", "Pinch salt", "8 oz semi-sweet chocolate, (best quality such as Ghiradelli, chopped)", "Cocoa powder,"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium microwave-safe bowl, combine the heavy cream, Baileys, butter and salt. Microwave on high power until the mixture comes to a boil, 70 to 80 seconds. Watch that it doesn't boil over. Add the chocolate and let sit for about 30 seconds to melt. Using a whisk, stir until the chocolate is completely melted and the mixture is glossy and smooth. Refrigerate until completely firm, about 3 hours or overnight (to speed this chilling process up, pour the mixture into a wide, shallow bowl or pie plate).", "name": "In a medium microwave-safe bowl, combine the heavy cream, Baileys, butter and salt. Microwave on high power until the mixture comes to a boil, 70 to 80 seconds. Watch that it doesn't boil over. Add the chocolate and let sit for about 30 seconds to melt. Using a whisk, stir until the chocolate is completely melted and the mixture is glossy and smooth. Refrigerate until completely firm, about 3 hours or overnight (to speed this chilling process up, pour the mixture into a wide, shallow bowl or pie plate).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baileys-chocolate-truffles.html#wprm-recipe-71874-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place your coating(s) on a plate. Dust your fingertips with the cocoa powder or the confectioners&#39; sugar/cocoa mixture. Use your fingertips to shape into a rough ball. Quickly and gently roll in your palms to form into a smooth ball, then roll in your topping of choice. (If the chocolate starts to melt from the warmth of your palms, drop the truffle into the cocoa or confectioners&#39; sugar/cocoa mixture and lightly coat, then continue rolling. You may need to wash your hands in cold water from time to time.) Place the truffles in a single layer on a plate or in a storage container, cover, and refrigerate. Remove from the refrigerator about 10 minutes before serving (keep in mind that they&#39;ll get too soft if left out at room temperature for too long). The truffles will keep for a couple of weeks in the refrigerator. They can also be frozen for up to two months.", "name": "Using a small spoon, scoop out about 2 teaspoons of the chocolate mixture. Dust your fingertips with the cocoa powder or the confectioners&#39; sugar/cocoa mixture. Use your fingertips to shape into a rough ball. Quickly and gently roll in your palms to form into a smooth ball, then roll in your topping of choice. (If the chocolate starts to melt from the warmth of your palms, drop the truffle into the cocoa or confectioners&#39; sugar/cocoa mixture and lightly coat, then continue rolling. You may need to wash your hands in cold water from time to time.) Place the truffles in a single layer on a plate or in a storage container, cover, and refrigerate. Remove from the refrigerator about 10 minutes before serving (keep in mind that they&#39;ll get too soft if left out at room temperature for too long). "ouac-fv-recipe-12126", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Millionaire's Shortbread", "description": "With a buttery shortbread base, gooey caramel center, and rich chocolate topping, millionaire\u2019s shortbread bars are every bit as decadent as their name suggests.", "prepTime": "PT0M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT2H", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "174", "fatContent": "9 g", "carbohydrateContent": "23 g", "proteinContent": "2 g", "saturatedFatContent": "5 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "17 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "54 mg", "cholesterolContent": "27 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Line a 9-inch square pan with aluminum foil, pushing the foil neatly into the corners and up the sides of the pan, using two pieces if necessary to ensure that the foil overlaps all edges (the overhang will help removal from the pan). Spray the foil with nonstick cooking spray or grease with butter.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade, combine the flour, brown sugar, cornstarch, and salt; process until well combined and no lumps of sugar remain. Add the butter and egg yolk; process for 10 to 15 seconds, until a coarse meal forms. Add the ice water and blend until you have a moist, crumbly dough, about 10 seconds more. Dump the dough into the prepared pan and press with your fingers into an even layer (dust your fingers with flour if the dough is too sticky). Prick the dough all over with a fork and bake until golden, about 20 minutes. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium, heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the sweetened condensed milk, heavy cream, corn syrup, vanilla, brown sugar, and salt, whisking until evenly combined. Bring to a simmer and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the mixture registers between 236\u00b0F and 239\u00b0F on an instant-read digital thermometer, 10 to 20 minutes. (Note: It's important to use an instant-read thermometer, rather than a clip-on candy thermometer, as temperatures can vary in different spots of the caramel. An instant-read thermometer allows you to test the temperature in multiple areas for accuracy; aim for an average if the readings differ.) Once the caramel reaches the desired temperature, carefully pour it over the crust\u2014remember, it\u2019s extremely hot. Tilt the pan to spread the caramel evenly. Let sit for 30 to 35 minutes, until the caramel layer is set but still slightly warm. (See note below on cleaning the pot.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the semi-sweet and milk chocolate in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave in 20-second bursts, stirring in between, until the chocolate is about 75% melted. Continue melting in 5 to 10 second-bursts, stirring in between until the chocolate is melted and smooth. Do not overheat or the mixture will break.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using an offset spatula, spread the chocolate evenly over the caramel layer. Refrigerate until the bars are cold and the chocolate is set, 1\u00bd to 2 hours. Let the bars sit out for 10 to 15 minutes to soften the chocolate slightly. Lift the bars out of the pan using the foil overhang and transfer to a cutting board. Using a sharp knife, cut into small squares (if the chocolate seems brittle, let the bars sit at room temperature a bit longer before cutting). Sprinkle the bars with flaky sea salt. Store in the refrigerator; serve cold or slightly chilled.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead Instructions: These bars can be prepared up to 3 days in advance and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Freezing is not recommended, as it may cause the chocolate to bloom.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Tip for cleaning the caramel pot: To easily clean any caramel residue, fill the pot with water and bring it to a boil. The hot water will loosen the stuck-on caramel, making it much easier to clean.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-caramel-shortbread-squares-a-k-a-millionaires-shortbread.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off ", "\u00bc cup dark brown sugar", "2 teaspoons cornstarch", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "1 stick (\u00bd cup) cold unsalted butter, cut into \u00bd-inch cubes", "1 large egg yolk", "1 tablespoon ice water", "1 stick (\u00bd cup)  unsalted butter ", "1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk ", "\u00bd cup  heavy cream ", "\u00bd cup  light corn syrup ", "1 teaspoon  vanilla extract ", "1 cup (packed) dark brown sugar ", "\u00bd teaspoon  salt", "3 ounces  semi-sweet chocolate, chopped", "3 ounces  milk chocolate, chopped", " Flaky sea salt, for serving "], "recipeYield": "20 to 25 squares", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/Millionaires-shortbread-1.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/Millionaires-shortbread-1-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/Millionaires-shortbread-1-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/11/Millionaires-shortbread-1-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.56, "ratingCount": "54"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-30T07:11:02-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Chocolate, Cornstarch, Golden Syrup, Sweetened Condensed Milk", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Meanwhile, I noticed several posting wondering how to make it without an ice cream maker.  I've done a lot of internet searching to find a good method and, at last, I found it on Handle the Heat (search for how to make ice cream without a machine). The 4th method described (using a food processor) gave perfect results so I'm no longer thinking of buying an ice cream maker.  The method: \r\nMake any ice cream base according to the recipe directions.\r\nWhen cool, pour into a ziptop bag, squeeze out all air, and seal.\r\nFreeze, lying flat, until solid (overnight was good).\r\nRemove from freezer and break into chunks small enough to fit into the bowl of your food processor or a high-powered blender (I cooled my bowl &amp; blade for half an hour in the fridge first)\r\nPulse until completely smooth (it will eventually look like crumbs but will soon become smooth and creamy).  For a simple vanilla ice cream, this took about 4 minutes for me.\r\nIf adding mix-ins, either fold them in or pulse until desired consistency is reached, then pour into an airtight container.\r\nCover and freeze until ready to serve.\r\nI will be making this enticing banana ice cream using this processor method next week, and will report on how it turns out.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Vivienne"}, "datePublished": "2024-10-15"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "This recipe is a keeper! Microwave on medium power (50%) for 1 minute, then stir until the bowl no longer feels warm. Continue heating in 15-second intervals, stirring each time until the chocolate is smooth and melted. The mixture may appear a bit gloppy and separated during the melting process \u2014 this is normal. However, it should become smooth and glossy once fully melted. Be careful not to overheat, as this can cause the chocolate to separate.", "name": "Combine the chocolate chips and heavy cream in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on medium power (50%) for 1 minute, then stir until the bowl no longer feels warm. Continue heating in 15-second intervals, stirring each time until the chocolate is smooth and melted. The mixture may appear a bit gloppy and separated during the melting process \u2014 this is normal. However, it should become smooth and glossy once fully melted. Be careful not to overheat, as this can cause the chocolate to separate.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-peanut-butter-squares.html#wprm-recipe-51720-step-2-0"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "Assemble the Bars", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle \u2153 cup of the ganache evenly over the cooled crust; spread into a thin layer with an offset spatula\u2014don&#39;t worry about making it perfect, and try not to crumble the crust. Place the pan in the freezer until the chocolate is set, about 10 minutes. Dollop the peanut butter filling over the chocolate, then use your hands to press it into an even layer. (If the mixture is sticky, dust your hands with confectioners&#39; sugar.) Reheat the remaining chocolate mixture on full power for 15 to 20 seconds in the microwave and stir until smooth. Pour it over the peanut butter layer and use the offset spatula to smooth it to the edges. Place the bars in the freezer for 1 hour or in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours to set. Once firm, use the foil overhang to lift the bars onto a cutting board. Using a sharp chef&#39;s knife, cut into small squares, as they are very rich. Store the bars in the refrigerator and serve cold. They will keep nicely in the fridge for up to 4 days.", "name": "Drizzle \u2153 cup of the ganache evenly over the cooled crust; spread into a thin layer with an offset spatula\u2014don&#39;t worry about making it perfect, and try not to crumble the crust. (If the mixture is sticky, dust your hands with confectioners&#39; sugar.) Reheat the remaining chocolate mixture on full power for 15 to 20 seconds in the microwave and stir until smooth. Pour it over the peanut butter layer and use the offset spatula to smooth it to the edges. Place the bars in the freezer for 1 hour or in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours to set. Once firm, use the foil overhang to lift the bars onto a cutting board. Using a sharp chef&#39;s knife, cut into small squares, as they are very rich. Store the bars in the refrigerator and serve cold. "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bearnaise-sauce.html#faq-question-1717086224328", "name": "Can I make b\u00e9arnaise sauce ahead?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "While b\u00e9arnaise sauce is best made fresh, simply because you don't need to fuss with keeping it warm, you can prepare it up to 2 hours ahead of time. To keep the sauce warm, pre-warm a thermos with boiling water, then empty it and transfer the sauce inside. Alternatively, use a makeshift double boiler: fill a small pot with water, bring it to a gentle simmer, then remove from the heat. Place your bowl of hollandaise sauce on top. The residual heat will keep the sauce warm without further cooking, preventing it from curdling or separating. Remember to stir the sauce occasionally to maintain an even temperature throughout.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bearnaise-sauce.html#faq-question-1717088642554", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bearnaise-sauce.html#faq-question-1717088642554", "name": "What can I serve b\u00e9arnaise sauce with?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "B\u00e9arnaise is a classic sauce often found at upscale steakhouses and French bistros. If you run your finger through the sauce on the spoon, it should leave a clear path.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "B\u00e9arnaise Sauce", "author": {"@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/#/schema/person/d09ca52c9e790675f71c46404845af62"}, "description": "If you think b\u00e9arnaise sauce is reserved for fancy restaurant meals, think again! "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the dough: In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, warm water, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add the eggs and egg yolk and whisk until evenly combined. Add the flour all at once, and stir with a wooden spoon until uniform and all of the flour is absorbed. The dough will be wet, lumpy and somewhat elastic (it will firm up in the fridge and smooth out when you knead it later). Cover loosely with plastic wrap (be sure the bowl is completely covered but don't make it airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 2 hours, then refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to three days.", "name": "Make the dough: In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, warm water, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add the eggs and egg yolk and whisk until evenly combined. Add the flour all at once, and stir with a wooden spoon until uniform and all of the flour is absorbed. The dough will be wet, lumpy and somewhat elastic (it will firm up in the fridge and smooth out when you knead it later). Cover loosely with plastic wrap (be sure the bowl is completely covered but don't make it airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 2 hours, then refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to three days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-babka.html#wprm-recipe-76968-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On the day of baking, grease a 9 x 5-in (23 x 13-cm) loaf pan generously with butter.", "name": "On the day of baking, grease a 9 x 5-in (23 x 13-cm) loaf pan generously with butter.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-babka.html#wprm-recipe-76968-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dust a clean work surface with flour. Remove the dough from the refrigerator, transfer it to the work surface, and dust it lightly with flour. Knead with your hands, sprinkling more flour as necessary so the dough doesn&#39;t stick, for 30 seconds. Roll out the dough into a 14-in (36-cm) square, dusting more flour underneath and over the dough as necessary; it should be about \u215b-in (3-mm) thick.", "name": "Dust a clean work surface with flour. Remove the dough from the refrigerator, transfer it to the work surface, and dust it lightly with flour. Knead with your hands, sprinkling more flour as necessary so the dough doesn&#39;t stick, for 30 seconds. Roll out the dough into a 14-in (36-cm) square, dusting more flour underneath and over the dough as necessary; it should be about \u215b-in (3-mm) thick.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-babka.html#wprm-recipe-76968-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using an offset spatula, spread the Nutella over the dough, leaving a \u00bd-in (13-mm) border. Sprinkle the chocolate over the Nutella. Starting with the side closest to you, roll the dough tightly into a log; turn it vertically, so one end of the log is facing you, and place seam side down. Using a sharp serrated bread knife, cut the log in half lengthwise. Turn the cut sides up and twist the strands together, keeping the cut sides facing up. Transfer the twisted dough to the prepared loaf pan, tucking the ends under if necessary. (This is a messy process; just do your best \u2013\u00a0it will look pretty no matter how messy it is).", "name": "Using an offset spatula, spread the Nutella over the dough, leaving a \u00bd-in (13-mm) border. Sprinkle the chocolate over the Nutella. Starting with the side closest to you, roll the dough tightly into a log; turn it vertically, so one end of the log is facing you, and place seam side down. Using a sharp serrated bread knife, cut the log in half lengthwise. Turn the cut sides up and twist the strands together, keeping the cut sides facing up. Transfer the twisted dough to the prepared loaf pan, tucking the ends under if necessary. (This is a messy process; just do your best \u2013\u00a0it will look pretty no matter how messy it is).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-babka.html#wprm-recipe-76968-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the babka loosely with plastic wrap (not airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 90 minutes. A toothpick or cake tester inserted into the center of the loaf should come out without any wet dough sticking to it (melted chocolate is okay). If you have an instant-read thermometer, it should read between 190\u00b0F (88\u00b0C) to 200\u00b0F (93\u00b0C) in the center of the loaf.", "name": "Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, until the babka is a rich golden brown color. If you need to prepare it further in advance, the cake layers can be frozen, without frosting, for up to 3 months. "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup confectioners' sugar", "2\u00bc cups all-purpose flour, (spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off (plus more for rolling the dough))", "\u00be teaspoon salt", "2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, (cut into cubes, very cold)", "3  large egg yolks, (divided)", "1 to 2 tablespoons ice cold water", "\u00be cup apricot jam, (best quality such as Bonne Maman)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the confectioners&#39; sugar, flour and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process for 10 to 15 seconds to combine. Add the butter and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add 2 of the egg yolks and pulse a few times, until the mixture is crumbly and pale yellow. Add 1 tablespoon of the water and pulse just until the dough starts to clump together. If the mixture seems dry, add the remaining tablespoon of water and pulse again. Dump the dough onto a lightly floured work surface and knead a few times into a smooth ball. Divide in half and pat into two 6-inch (15-cm) discs; wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.", "name": "Combine the confectioners&#39; sugar, flour and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Process for 10 to 15 seconds to combine. Add the butter and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add 2 of the egg yolks and pulse a few times, until the mixture is crumbly and pale yellow. Add 1 tablespoon of the water and pulse just until the dough starts to clump together. If the mixture seems dry, add the remaining tablespoon of water and pulse again. Dump the dough onto a lightly floured work surface and knead a few times into a smooth ball. Divide in half and pat into two 6-inch (15-cm) discs; wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/apricot-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-71527-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C) and set racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "name": "Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F (190\u00b0C) and set racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/apricot-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-71527-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, make an egg wash by mixing the remaining egg yolk with 1 teaspoon water. Set aside.", "name": "In a small bowl, make an egg wash by mixing the remaining egg yolk with 1 teaspoon water. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/apricot-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-71527-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the dough from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface. Working with one disc of dough at a time, roll to \u215b-inch (3-mm) thick, turning and dusting with more flour as necessary so it doesn&#39;t stick. Using a cookie cutter or glass, cut out 3-inch (7.5-cm) circles and place about \u00bd-inch (13-mm) apart on the prepared baking sheets. Re-roll and re-cut any excess dough. Brush the dough very lightly with the egg wash. Place a level teaspoon of apricot jam on the center of each cookie (do not overfill). Fold in the sides, slightly overlapping the filling, to form a triangle so that each side of the cookie has a corner that folds over and a corner that folds under -- this creates a pattern that looks pretty (but don&#39;t fuss too much over it). Pinch the corners together neatly so that they form a point.  Slide the pans into the refrigerator for 20 minutes to chill.", "name": "Remove the dough from the refrigerator and place on a lightly floured work surface. Working with one disc of dough at a time, roll to \u215b-inch (3-mm) thick, turning and dusting with more flour as necessary so it doesn&#39;t stick. Using a cookie cutter or glass, cut out 3-inch (7.5-cm) circles and place about \u00bd-inch (13-mm) apart on the prepared baking sheets. Re-roll and re-cut any excess dough. Brush the dough very lightly with the egg wash. Place a level teaspoon of apricot jam on the center of each cookie (do not overfill). Fold in the sides, slightly overlapping the filling, to form a triangle so that each side of the cookie has a corner that folds over and a corner that folds under -- this creates a pattern that looks pretty (but don&#39;t fuss too much over it). Pinch the corners together neatly so that they form a point.  Slide the pans into the refrigerator for 20 minutes to chill.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/apricot-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-71527-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, turning the pans halfway through baking, until the cookies are lightly golden on top and just starting to brown in the corners. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.", "name": "Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, turning the pans halfway through baking, until the cookies are lightly golden on top and just starting to brown in the corners. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/apricot-hamantaschen.html#wprm-recipe-71527-step-0-4"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.76", "ratingCount": "45", "reviewCount": "16"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Love these hamantaschen -- I think this is my 9th year making them! I make half raspberry and half apricot. The dough is a little challenging when it first comes out of the food processor because it's so crumbly. But I just keep smooshing it together and kneading, and then it becomes extremely easy and forgiving to work with. It rolls out beautifully. They're a family favorite!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Rachel"}, "datePublished": "2025-03-16"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "The recipe deserves 5 stars. This time, however, I increased the heat by grating a bar of  Sargento Fiesta Pepper Jack cheese, which has generous bits of 3 different hot chilies in it. Oh, yeah! Hid a small portion of the dip to make myself a savory oatmeal this morning with the reheated leftover dip plus a small splash of milk. Sprinkled a generous amount of TJ's Everything/Bagel over the top...stirred all, and YUM!!! This dip was heaven on my chip last night and in my oatmeal today!
