"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#faq-question-1707509696200", "name": "Can I freeze the scones?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Sure, the dough can be frozen for up to 3 months: Scoop the dough into mounds on a baking sheet, let set in the freezer, then place in a resealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) To freeze them after baking, let the scones cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or foil. Before serving, remove the scones from the container and let them come to room temperature. Ideally, it's best to freeze scones before baking.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#faq-question-1707511845556", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#faq-question-1707511845556", "name": "Are there any variations I can try with this recipe?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Definitely! Feel free to get creative with add-ins. You can swap out the pecans and currants for other nuts or dried fruits like chopped almonds or dried cranberries.  Don't be afraid to experiment and make these your own!", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#faq-question-1707511972080", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#faq-question-1707511972080", "name": "Can I use quick-cooking or instant oats instead of old-fashioned oats?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Quick cooking or instant oats won't work as well in this recipe because their texture is much finer and they tend to absorb liquid more quickly. Old-fashioned rolled oats provide a heartier texture and add a nice chewiness to the scones, whereas quick-cooking oats may make the scones a bit soft. Scatter the butter pieces over top and beat on low speed for about 30 seconds, or until the butter is somewhat broken down and grape-size pieces are still visible.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, whisk together the cream, maple syrup and egg until thoroughly mixed. Scrape the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula to ensure that all of the dry ingredients are incorporated into the dough. Using an ice cream scooper, drop mounded scoops of the dough (about \u2153 cup each) onto the prepared baking sheet, forming 8 scones and spacing them about 2 inches apart.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until scones are golden brown around the edges and lightly golden on top. Transfer to a wire rack to cool for about 30 minutes. (Hold on to the parchment paper -- you'll need it for adding the glaze.) ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the scones are cooling, make the glaze: In a small bowl, whisk together the confectioners' sugar, maple syrup and enough of the water to make a smooth, pourable glaze. When the scones have cooled for at least 30 minutes, transfer them back to the parchment-lined baking sheet and use a spoon to drizzle the glaze evenly over top.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/glazed-oatmeal-maple-scones-with-pecans-currants.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The dough can be frozen for up to 3 months:  Scoop the dough into mounds on a baking sheet, let set in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.)  <em><strong>To Freeze After Baking:</strong></em> Let the scones cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil.  Before serving, remove the scones from the container and let them come to room temperature.  **If you have the option to freeze the scones before or after baking them, you will get the best results if you freeze them before baking. "cholesterolContent": "0 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the raspberries and \u00bd cup of the lemon juice in a blender; pur\u00e9e until smooth, then pass the mixture through a fine sieve into a large bowl to strain out the seeds (the fastest way to force it through is by pressing a ladle against the strainer in a circular motion). Add the remaining lemon juice, water, and sugar to the bowl and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Taste, then and add more sugar, lemon juice or water if necessary (keep in mind that ice cubes will water it down). Pour into glasses with ice cubes and garnish with lemon wedges, raspberries and fresh mint, if desired. The lemonade will keep in the fridge for a few days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/raspberry-lemonade.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00be cups fresh squeezed lemon juice, from 8-12 lemons, strained", "\u00bd pound (8 oz.) raspberries, plus more for serving", "5 cups water", "1 cup sugar", " Lemon wedges, for serving", " Fresh mint, for serving"], "recipeYield": "1\u00be quarts", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2016/05/Raspberry-Lemonade-2-1200x844.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2016/05/Raspberry-Lemonade-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2016/05/Raspberry-Lemonade-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2016/05/Raspberry-Lemonade-2-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "23"}, "datePublished": "2016-05-26T07:26:59-04:00", "keywords": "Bbq, Father's Day, July 4th, Labor Day, Lemons, Mother's Day, Potluck, Raspberries, Summer", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350\u00b0F. Generously butter a 9-inch springform pan.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter in the microwave until foamy (watch carefully so that it doesn't boil and splatter). Add the chopped chocolate and stir until completely melted and smooth. (If necessary, pop the bowl back into the microwave for 20 seconds to melt any remaining bits of chocolate.) Add the sugar and whisk until well combined. Whisk in the eggs one at a time. Whisk in the cocoa powder, using a folding motion at first so it doesn't fly out of the bowl. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30 minutes, or until the cake is set. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the cake bakes, make the meringue topping. Bring \u00bd-inch of water to a boil in a small sauce pan, then lower the heat so that the water just simmers. Combine the egg whites, cream of tartar, and sugar in the bowl of an electric mixer (or any large heatproof bowl). Set the bowl over the pan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Whisk gently for about 3 minutes, until the egg whites are hot to the touch and the sugar is dissolved. Remove the bowl from the pan and attach it to the stand mixer. (Alternatively, a hand mixer can be used.) Fit the mixer with the whisk attachment (or beaters if using a hand mixer) and whisk on medium speed (or high if using a \r\nhand mixer) until the meringue is cooled, glossy and stiff, 5 to 6 minutes. You'll know it's ready when you lift the whisk out of the bowl and the meringue holds a firm peak that curls over. Set aside until the cake is done.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the cake comes out of the oven, give the meringue a quick whisk, then pile it onto the the hot cake, leaving a 1-inch border around the perimeter (it may spread a little and you don't want it to touch the sides of the pan). Use a small spoon to swirl it into dramatic peaks.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the cake back into the oven for 10 to 12 minutes, until the meringue peaks are lightly browned. Let the cake cool on a rack for about 15 minutes, then run a sharp knife around the edges, if necessary, to loosen any meringue that may have stuck to the sides. Carefully remove the sides of the springform pan. Transfer the cake to a platter and serve at room temperature. (Removing the base of the springform pan is optional: to do so, simply slide a large spatula underneath the cake and lift it off -- it is pretty sturdy.) To make neat slices through the meringue, wipe the knife clean between slices.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: The chocolate cake base may be made up to 2 days ahead of time. Once cool, wrap tightly in plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator. Wait until a few hours before serving to add the meringue (it is not necessary to heat the cake before adding the meringue, but do let it come to room temperature). ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: The easiest way to sift the cocoa powder is to pass it through a fine mesh sieve when adding it to the cake batter.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/flourless-chocolate-cake-meringue-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00bd sticks (12 tablespoons) unsalted butter, plus more for greasing the pan", "6 ounces semisweet chocolate, chopped  ", "1\u00bc cups sugar", "5 large eggs", "\u00bd cup Dutch-process cocoa powder, sifted (see note)", "4 large egg whites", "\u215b teaspoon cream of tartar", "\u00be cup sugar"], "recipeYield": "12", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/03/Flourless-Chocolate-Cake-with-Meringue-1200x1412.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/03/Flourless-Chocolate-Cake-with-Meringue-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/03/Flourless-Chocolate-Cake-with-Meringue-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/03/Flourless-Chocolate-Cake-with-Meringue-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.95, "ratingCount": "60"}, "datePublished": "2015-03-31T21:14:19-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Chocolate, Christmas, Cocoa Powder, Jewish Holiday Recipes, New Year's Eve, Passover, Springform Pan, Valentine's Day", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Even if you don\u2019t see much change in the appearance of the mixture, the acid has been added to your milk and will work just like the store-bought version.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/how-to-make-buttermilk.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon lemon juice or white vinegar", "1 cup minus 1 tablespoon milk, any kind"], "recipeYield": "1 cup", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/05/How-to-make-buttermilk-3-1200x819.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/05/How-to-make-buttermilk-3-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/05/How-to-make-buttermilk-3-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/05/How-to-make-buttermilk-3-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "2"}, "datePublished": "2022-05-19T05:53:41-04:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "How To &amp; Resources"}]

", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/coconut-lime-mexican-wedding-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F. Place the balls about 1\u00bd inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Bake until the edges of the cookies barely begin to brown, 12 to 14 minutes. Let the cookies cool for a few minutes on the baking sheets, then roll in the confectioners' sugar while still warm. Let the cookies cool on a rack, then roll again in confectioners' sugar once they are cool. Store in an airtight container at room temperature. Let set on a baking sheet in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) Once they are cool, roll them in confectioners' sugar again.  <em><strong>To Freeze After Baking:</strong></em> Let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. ", "prepTime": "PT0M", "cookTime": "PT0M", "totalTime": "PT0M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "164", "fatContent": "10g", "carbohydrateContent": "19g", "proteinContent": "4g", "saturatedFatContent": "1g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "13g", "fiberContent": "3g", "sodiumContent": "612mg", "cholesterolContent": "0mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the unpeeled garlic cloves in a small skillet over medium heat; cook, turning occasionally, until soft and blackened in spots, about 10 to 15 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-gazpacho.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the peeled roasted garlic to the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade; pulse, scraping down sides as necessary, until garlic is finely pur\u00e9ed. Add the chopped tomatoes and pulse until coarsely chopped. Do not overmix; the soup should be slightly chunky. Transfer the tomato mixture to an extra large bowl. Add the red bell peppers and cucumbers to the food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped; add to the bowl with the tomato mixture. Stir in the tomato juice, olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper and Tabasco. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Cover the bowl with saran wrap and chill until ready to serve. The longer it sits, the better it tastes. Serve cold.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-gazpacho.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}], "recipeIngredient": ["8 garlic cloves, unpeeled", "4  large vine-ripened tomatoes, cored and cut into 1-inch chunks", "2  red bell peppers, cored, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks", "1 English or hothouse cucumber, halved, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks (do not peel)", "5 cups tomato juice, such as Campbells's (not the low sodium)", "\u00bc cup extra virgin olive oil, best quality such as Colavita or Lucini", "\u00bc cup red wine vinegar, best quality such as Pompeian Gourmet ", "1\u00bd teaspoons salt", "\u00bd teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "\u00bd teaspoon Tabasco (optional)"], "recipeYield": "6-8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-1200x1752.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "20"}, "datePublished": "2012-06-21T08:08:14-04:00", "keywords": "Bell Peppers, Cucumbers, Picnic, Potluck, Summer, Tomatoes", "recipeCuisine": "Spanish", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal "}, "name": "Ricotta Cheesecake with Fresh Raspberries", "description": "Torn between an American or Italian-style cheesecake? This dessert offers the best of both worlds, combining the creamy richness of American cheesecake with the lighter, drier texture of Italian ricotta cheesecake, all nestled in a ground almond crust.", "prepTime": "PT50M", "cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT1H40M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 slice", "calories": "382", "fatContent": "23g", "carbohydrateContent": "32g", "proteinContent": "13g", "saturatedFatContent": "12g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "22g", "fiberContent": "2g", "sodiumContent": "207mg", "cholesterolContent": "126mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Spray a 9-inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray; dust it evenly with flour and tap out any excess.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the crust: place the almonds, flour, sugar and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade attachment. Process until the nuts are finely chopped and the mixture looks sandy. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk, cooled melted butter and vanilla. Add the liquid mixture to the nut mixture and pulse several times until the ingredients are well combined, moistened and crumbly. Dump the mixture into the prepared pan and, using your fingers or the bottom of a measuring cup, press into an even layer. Place the pan in the freezer for 10 minutes (or the refrigerator for 15 to 20 minutes) to chill; then bake for 10 to 15 minutes, until the crust is lightly golden. Let cool on a wire rack.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, make the filling: Combine the cream cheese, sugar and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade attachment. Process until soft and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the ricotta and process until the mixture is smooth and light, another 2 minutes. Add the eggs, one at a time, processing for 5 to 10 seconds between each addition. Add the vanilla, amaretto, cornstarch and orange zest and process until mixture is just combined (do not overmix).  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the filling into the crust, smoothing the top with a spatula. Bake the cheesecake for 50 to 60 minutes, until the top is lightly golden, the edges are set and the center is quite jiggly but not totally liquid (it will continue to cook as it cools). Carefully remove the cheesecake from the oven and allow it to cool completely on a wire rack. It will sink a bit\u2014that's okay. Once cool, If necessary, run a thin-bladed knife around the edge of the cake to make sure it's not sticking to the sides (which can cause cracks as it cools), then cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to cool for at least 8 hours or overnight.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For the topping: After the cake has chilled, spread the raspberry jam evenly over the top of the cheesecake, leaving a \u00be-inch border around the edge of the cake (essentially, the jam goes on the sunken part of the cake). Place the raspberries evenly over top. Using a fine sieve, dust the top of the cake with Confectioners' sugar. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For serving: Remove the sides of the springform pan. Serve the cheesecake right from the base of the pan; or, to transfer it to a serving platter, run a long, thin spatula between the crust and the pan bottom, and then use two large spatulas to carefully transfer the cheesecake to a serving dish. Slice with a sharp knife, wiping the knife clean between slices. The cake keeps well for several days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The cheesecake may also be frozen without the topping for up to 3 months. To freeze: place the cake in the freezer briefly, unwrapped, to firm it up. Then double-wrap it tightly with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap, or place it in heavy-duty freezer bag.  Thaw in the refrigerator the night before you plan to eat it.  Prepare the topping prior to serving the cheesecake.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/ricotta-cheesecake.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00be cup slivered almonds", "\u00bc cup all purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off", "3 tablespoons granulated sugar", "Pinch of salt", "1  large egg yolk", "2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled", "\u00bd teaspoon vanilla extract", "1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, at room temperature (preferably Philadelphia brand)", "\u00be cup granulated sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon kosher salt", "1 (32-ounce) tub (about 4 cups) whole milk ricotta (do not use low-fat)", "3 large eggs", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "1 tablespoon amaretto (rum or Grand Marnier may be substituted)", "1 tablespoon cornstarch", "2 teaspoons orange zest, from one orange", "\u2153 cup seedless raspberry jam, best quality ", "8 ounces (about 2\u00bd cups) fresh raspberries (you'll need a pint but you'll have extra)", " Confectioners' sugar, for dusting"], "recipeYield": "one 9-inch cake, about 12 servings", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/06/Ricotta-Cheesecake-Hero-3.jpg", "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-30571", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "P\u00e2te Sucr\u00e9e (Sweet Tart Dough)", "description": "A p\u00e2te sucr\u00e9e is a crisp yet tender pastry crust that is slightly sweet. It maintains its shortbread-like texture when chilled, which makes it ideal for tarts that require refrigeration.", "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "169", "fatContent": "10 g", "carbohydrateContent": "19 g", "proteinContent": "2 g", "saturatedFatContent": "6 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "7 g", "fiberContent": "0 g", "sodiumContent": "60 mg", "cholesterolContent": "39 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, cream the butter, sugar, and salt on medium speed until pale and creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Add the flour and mix on low speed for about 30 seconds, until the flour is incorporated. The mixture will look like wet, clumpy sand. Add the egg yolk and mix on low speed until the yolk is evenly incorporated and the dough is clumpy, about 30 seconds. Using your hand, lightly knead the dough into a ball inside the bowl. Remove the dough from the bowl, press it into a 6-inch disk, wrap it tightly in plastic wrap, and let it rest in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. (The dough can be tightly wrapped in plastic and stored in the refrigerator for up to 5 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months. If frozen, thaw it in the refrigerator overnight before using.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pate-sucree-sweet-tart-dough.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly spray a 9.5-inch tart pan with a removable bottom or a 9-inch pie shell with nonstick cooking spray with flour. Place the chilled dough inside the pan. Pinch off pieces of dough and press them against the sides of the pan to reach about \u215b-inch thick and about \u215b inch above the rim (you'll trim the top later). Using the heel of your hand, press the rest of the dough evenly into the bottom of the pan. (It will look like a mess, and it may seem like you won't have enough dough at first, but have faith, it will come together.) Be sure there are no seams in the dough, and press it squarely along the corners where the bottom meets the sides to avoid extra-thick edges. Use a paring knife to trim the top edge of the dough so it is even with the rim of the pan. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the freezer for at least 30 minutes to chill. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pate-sucree-sweet-tart-dough.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pate-sucree-sweet-tart-dough.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the chilled p\u00e2te sucr\u00e9e on a baking sheet (for easy handling) and bake for 23 to 26 minutes, or until lightly golden. Let cool to room temperature on a wire rack. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pate-sucree-sweet-tart-dough.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 stick (\u00bd cup) unsalted butter, at room temperature", "\u2153 cup  sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon  salt", "1\u00bc cups  all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off ", "1  egg yolk", " Nonstick cooking spray with flour, for baking"], "recipeYield": "One fully baked 10-inch tart shell or 9-inch pie shell", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/06/Pate-Sucree-8-1200x923.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/06/Pate-Sucree-8-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/06/Pate-Sucree-8-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/06/Pate-Sucree-8-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.69, "ratingCount": "35"}, "datePublished": "2021-07-01T06:10:13-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons", "recipeCuisine": "French", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT70M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled, plus more for greasing the pans", "1 cup warm water ((see note))", "\u00bd cup sugar", "2\u00bc teaspoons salt", "2 teaspoons instant/rapid-rise yeast", "6  large eggs, (divided (5 for dough and 1 for egg wash))", "5\u00bd cups all-purpose flour, (spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off, plus more for kneading and braiding)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, warm water, sugar, salt and yeast. Add 5 of the eggs and whisk until evenly combined. Add the flour all at once and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture is uniform; it will be wet, lumpy, and a bit elastic (it will firm up in the fridge and smooth out when you knead it). Cover loosely with plastic wrap (make sure the entire bowl is covered but don't seal it airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 2 hours, then refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to three days.", "name": "In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, warm water, sugar, salt and yeast. Add 5 of the eggs and whisk until evenly combined. Add the flour all at once and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture is uniform; it will be wet, lumpy, and a bit elastic (it will firm up in the fridge and smooth out when you knead it). Cover loosely with plastic wrap (make sure the entire bowl is covered but don't seal it airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 2 hours, then refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to three days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/brioche.html#wprm-recipe-73738-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On the day of baking, grease an 8\u00bd x 4\u00bd-inch (21 x 11-cm) loaf pan with butter (or two loaf pans if you&#39;re baking both loaves at the same time). Dust a clean work surface generously with flour. Dust the dough in the bowl with flour and use a knife to cut it in half. Pull out half of the dough and place it on the floured work surface; cover the remaining half with plastic wrap (not airtight) and place it back in the refrigerator until ready to bake. (The dough can be used anytime within the 3-day window, or frozen in an airtight container for up to two weeks. When ready to use the frozen dough, thaw in the refrigerator for 24 hours before using, then continue with the next step.)", "name": "On the day of baking, grease an 8\u00bd x 4\u00bd-inch (21 x 11-cm) loaf pan with butter (or two loaf pans if you&#39;re baking both loaves at the same time). Dust a clean work surface generously with flour. Dust the dough in the bowl with flour and use a knife to cut it in half. Pull out half of the dough and place it on the floured work surface; cover the remaining half with plastic wrap (not airtight) and place it back in the refrigerator until ready to bake. (The dough can be used anytime within the 3-day window, or frozen in an airtight container for up to two weeks. When ready to use the frozen dough, thaw in the refrigerator for 24 hours before using, then continue with the next step.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/brioche.html#wprm-recipe-73738-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dust the dough with more flour and knead, sprinkling more flour as necessary so the dough doesn&#39;t stick, for about 30 seconds. Divide the dough into 3 equal portions (about 9 oz/255 g each) and, using your hands, roll each one into a 13-inch (33-cm) strand. Pinch the three strands together at the top and braid. Place the braided dough into the prepared loaf pan, tucking the ends underneath. (Alternatively, if you don&#39;t want to braid the dough, simply elongate it into an oval and place in the prepared pan.) Cover the pan loosely with plastic wrap (not airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 90 minutes. (It will rise just a bit.)", "name": "Dust the dough with more flour and knead, sprinkling more flour as necessary so the dough doesn&#39;t stick, for about 30 seconds. Divide the dough into 3 equal portions (about 9 oz/255 g each) and, using your hands, roll each one into a 13-inch (33-cm) strand. Pinch the three strands together at the top and braid. Place the braided dough into the prepared loaf pan, tucking the ends underneath. (Alternatively, if you don&#39;t want to braid the dough, simply elongate it into an oval and place in the prepared pan.) Cover the pan loosely with plastic wrap (not airtight) and let sit at room temperature for 90 minutes. (It will rise just a bit.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/brioche.html#wprm-recipe-73738-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (175\u00b0C) and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/brioche.html#wprm-recipe-73738-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Beat the remaining egg in a small bowl. Let cool in the pan on a rack for 15 minutes, then turn out and let cool completely before slicing.", "name": "Beat the remaining egg in a small bowl. It's unbelievably soft and moist, and the rich buttery crust is delicious.  I've made brioche several times using the more traditional method of mixing the dough, but this bread is on a par with any brioche I've made so far, and I loved the simplicity of making the dough by hand.  I made a half recipe in an 8 1/2 x 4 1/2-inch pan, using 2 whole eggs and 1 yolk, reserving the white for the egg wash.  After leaving the dough in the fridge for 8 hours, I shaped it, put it in the pan, then back in the fridge for 4 hours.  The chilled loaf sat at room temperature for 3 1/2 hours and was puffed and had risen to just below the top of the pan when I put it in the oven.  I didn't do the braiding.  The baked loaf was slightly lopsided, but brioche has a tendency to do that. "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set a liquid measuring cup with about \u00bd cup of water next to the stove. In a 12-inch skillet (preferably <strong>not</strong> nonstick), melt 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat. Add the sliced onions, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are meltingly tender and a rich, deep caramel color, 20 to 25 minutes. To help the caramelization process along and prevent the onions from burning, deglaze the pan every so often with a few tablespoons of the water\u2014but wait to do this until you see a brown film forming on the bottom of the pan. I usually use about \u00bd cup of water total, but you may need a bit more or less. Add the cumin and cinnamon and stir well. Reduce the heat to low and cook one minute more, stirring occasionally, to allow the onion to absorb the flavors of the spices and caramelize a bit more. Season with \u00bc teaspoon of the salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rice-pilaf-with-caramelized-onion-orange-cherry-pistachio.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the orange juice over the cherries in a small bowl to hydrate them, if necessary adding enough water to cover completely. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rice-pilaf-with-caramelized-onion-orange-cherry-pistachio.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a heavy 3-qt. saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-low heat. Add the diced onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add the rice and the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt, reduce the heat to low, and stir well to coat each grain with butter. Toast for a full 5 minutes, stirring regularly to keep the grains separated and to prevent them from sticking to the bottom of the pan.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rice-pilaf-with-caramelized-onion-orange-cherry-pistachio.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add 2\u00bd cups water, stir once, and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce the heat to low, and cook for 18 minutes. Remove from the heat, and let the pilaf sit, still covered, for 5 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rice-pilaf-with-caramelized-onion-orange-cherry-pistachio.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the pilaf has rested, remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork. Strain the cherries and discard the orange juice. Using the fork, gently fold in the cherries, caramelized onions, pistachios, and \u00bc teaspoon packed orange zest. Taste and adjust seasoning, adding more salt, pepper and orange zest, if desired. (Note: Orange zest is very strong and somewhat bitter in flavor so be sure to add it little by little.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rice-pilaf-with-caramelized-onion-orange-cherry-pistachio.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}], "recipeIngredient": ["4 tablespoons  unsalted butter", "3  medium onions: 2 thinly sliced into half-moons; 1 finely diced", "\u00bd teaspoon ground cumin", "\u00bd teaspoon  ground cinnamon", "1\u00bc teaspoon salt", " Freshly ground black pepper", "1  orange, zest (you'll use about \u00bc tsp) and juice ", "\u00be cup  sweetened dried tart cherries", "1\u00bd cups long-grain white rice", "\u00be cup (3.5 oz)  unsalted shelled pistachios"], "recipeYield": "6 to 8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/01/Rice-Pilaf-1200x916.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/01/Rice-Pilaf-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/01/Rice-Pilaf-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/01/Rice-Pilaf-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Modestly adapted from Chef Ris Lacoste", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.46, "ratingCount": "24"}, "datePublished": "2018-02-07T16:56:13-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Caramelized Onions, Dried Fruit, Nuts, Oranges, Rice", "recipeCuisine": "Middle Eastern, Moroccan", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

["4\u2154 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled off, plus more for rolling", "\u00bd cup cornstarch", "\u00bd cup granulated sugar", "1 tablespoon instant or rapid-rise yeast (note this is more than 1 packet)", "1\u00bd teaspoons salt", "1 cup + 2 tablespoons whole milk, lukewarm (about 110\u00b0F/43\u00b0C)", "2  large eggs, at room temperature", "1  large egg yolk, at room temperature", "\u00bd cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, sliced into 8 pieces, softened", "1 cup (packed) light brown sugar", "1\u00bd tablespoons ground cinnamon", "5 tablespoons unsalted butter, "HowToSection", "name": "For the Dough", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the dough hook, add the flour, cornstarch, granulated sugar, yeast, and salt. Stir with a rubber spatula or large spoon to combine. With the mixer running on low speed (2), slowly add the milk, whole eggs, and egg yolk, mixing until the dough starts to come together in a shaggy texture. Gradually add the butter, one tablespoon at a time, mixing until fully incorporated. The dough will be very soft and sticky at this stage\u2014don\u2019t worry, that\u2019s exactly how it should be. Continue kneading for about 10 minutes, until the dough is smooth and pulls away from the sides of the bowl but still sticks to the bottom. Again, if the dough feels soft and tacky, that\u2019s perfectly normal.", "name": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the dough hook, add the flour, cornstarch, granulated sugar, yeast, and salt. Gradually add the butter, one tablespoon at a time, mixing until fully incorporated. The dough will be very soft and sticky at this stage\u2014don\u2019t worry, that\u2019s exactly how it should be. Continue kneading for about 10 minutes, until the dough is smooth and pulls away from the sides of the bowl but still sticks to the bottom. Gently shape the cylinder with your hands to even it out and press in the sides so it\u2019s uniform in width. Using a sharp knife, cut the cylinder in half, then cut each piece in half again, and finally, cut each section into thirds to create 12 rolls. Transfer the rolls, cut-side up, to the prepared pan. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 1 hour. (Alternatively, if you plan to bake the rolls the next day, put them in the fridge. When ready to serve, let them sit at room temperature for 1 hour before baking.)", "name": "Starting with the 22-inch wide edge closest to you, roll the dough into a tight cylinder, pinching the seam to seal. Gently shape the cylinder with your hands to even it out and press in the sides so it\u2019s uniform in width. Using a sharp knife, cut the cylinder in half, then cut each piece in half again, and finally, cut each section into thirds to create 12 rolls. Transfer the rolls, cut-side up, to the prepared pan. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 1 hour. (Alternatively, if you plan to bake the rolls the next day, put them in the fridge. When ready to serve, let them sit at room temperature for 1 hour before baking.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/homemade-cinnamon-rolls.html#wprm-recipe-58894-step-1-3"}]}, {"@type": "HowToSection", "name": "To Bake and Frost", "itemListElement": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. "CategoryParent", "@id": 2, "slug": "recipes", "name": "Recipes"}]}, {"@id": 868, "parent": 2, "slug": "vegetarian", "name": "Vegetarian", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 2, "slug": "recipes", "name": "Recipes"}]}], "tags": ["Christmas", "Comfort Food", "Fall", "Potatoes", "Thanksgiving", "Winter"], "taxonomies": [{"name": "ouac_cuisine", "label": "Cuisines", "description": "", "terms": [{"@id": 1128, "name": "American", "slug": "american"}]}]}]}, {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-20643", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Creamy Make-Ahead Mashed Potatoes", "description": "Perfect for the busy holidays, these ultra-creamy make-ahead mashed potatoes can be prepared two days ahead of time and reheated in the microwave. ", "prepTime": "PT0M", "cookTime": "PT0M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "464", "fatContent": "34 g", "carbohydrateContent": "38 g", "proteinContent": "6 g", "saturatedFatContent": "21 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "3 g", "fiberContent": "3 g", "sodiumContent": "470 mg", "cholesterolContent": "112 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 450\u00b0F and adjust an oven rack to the middle position. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prick each potato a few times all over with a fork. Place the potatoes directly on the oven rack (alternatively, you can place them on a wire rack set in a rimmed baking sheet). Bake until very soft, 50 to 60 minutes, depending on the size of the potatoes. (Err on the side of overcooking rather than undercooking them.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the potatoes from the oven. While they are still hot, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Using an oven mitt or a folded kitchen towel to hold the hot potatoes, scoop out all of the flesh from each potato half into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (*see note below on using a potato ricer, food mill or hand-held electric mixer). The flesh near the skin gets a little tough, so be sure to leave it behind. Break the cooked potato flesh down into small pieces using a potato masher, fork, or rubber spatula. Beat on low speed until completely smooth and no lumps remain, 1 to 2 minutes, stopping the mixer to scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. (Note: it\u2019s important to mash the potatoes while they are still hot, otherwise you\u2019ll end up with lumps.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, bring the cream and 6 tablespoons of the butter to a simmer. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the bowl from the mixer stand and, using a large rubber spatula, gradually fold in the hot cream and butter mixture. It will take a few minutes to mix it all in; keep folding until the potatoes are smooth and creamy. Stir in the salt, then taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a large microwave-safe bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap (the bowl should be large enough that the potatoes don\u2019t touch the plastic wrap). Refrigerate for up to 2 days. (DO NOT FREEZE)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To reheat, use the tip of a knife to poke about 10 holes in the plastic wrap, and microwave at medium-high (75 percent) power until the potatoes are hot, about 14 minutes, stirring halfway through the reheating time. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a serving dish, top with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, and sprinkle with the chives. Serve hot.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Notes: For perfectly smooth potatoes, pass the potato flesh through a potato ricer or food mill before adding them to the mixer. If you don't have a stand mixer, you can use a hand-held electric mixer. If you don't have an electric mixer, pass the potatoes through a food mill or potato ricer and then whip by hand with a wooden spoon.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Oven-Reheating Instructions: If you\u2019d prefer to reheat the potatoes in the oven, transfer them to an oven-safe dish, cover tightly with foil, and bake in a 350\u00b0F oven for 30 to 40 minutes, stirring halfway through to ensure they heat evenly.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-make-ahead-mashed-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3\u00bd pounds  Russet potatoes", "2 cups  heavy cream", "8 tablespoons  unsalted butter, divided", "1\u00bd teaspoons  salt", " Chives, for serving"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-1200x1572.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/11/Make-Ahead-Mashed-Potatoes-6-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from Cooks Illustrated", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.79, "ratingCount": "513"}, "datePublished": "2017-11-14T16:06:07-05:00", "keywords": "Christmas, Comfort Food, Fall, Potatoes, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of a food processor, process the sugar and almonds until the almonds are finely ground and the mixture is powdery, about 1 minute. Add the flour, salt, and butter and pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal, about twenty 1-second pulses. Add the egg yolks, vanilla, and almond extract and process until dough forms a crumbly, clumpy mass, 20 to 25 seconds. Transfer the dough to a clean work surface and knead it into a smooth ball. Divide the dough in half and form two disks, wrap each disk tightly with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 30 minutes or up to 4 days.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/linzer-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust the oven racks to the upper-middle and lower-middle positions and heat the oven to 375\u00b0F. (The longer the dough is refrigerated, the more you will have to knead it; just be careful not to overwork it \u2013 it should still feel cool.) Liberally dust a clean work surface with flour, and roll out the dough to \u215b-inch thickness. Using a 2.5-inch round cookie cutter, cut out circles. After creating the circles, use a 1-inch round, heart, or any-shaped cookie cutter to cut out the centers from half of the circles (these will be the top halves of the cookies).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/linzer-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a metal spatula, transfer the cookies to the prepared baking sheets, spacing about 1 inch apart.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/linzer-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gather up the scraps, knead into a flat disc, roll, and repeat (if too warm, pop back in the fridge for a bit). The assembled cookies can also be frozen in an airtight container for up to 1 month. "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and adjust the oven rack to the middle position. Blend until the mixture has a fine, sand-like texture. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/raspberry-jam-bars.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat the butter with the granulated sugar and brown sugar on medium speed until light and creamy, a few minutes. Add the egg and beat until well combined. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat on low speed until just combined. The dough will be sticky. Place \u2154 of the dough on the bottom of the prepared baking dish, using an offset spatula to spread it into an even layer. (If you don\u2019t have an offset spatula, lightly wet your fingers and press the dough into an even layer.) Spread the jam over the surface of the dough, leaving \u00bc-inch space between the jam and the sides of the baking dish so the bars won\u2019t stick to the foil. Pinch off 1-inch clumps of the remaining dough and scatter evenly over top of the jam. The dough won\u2019t cover the entire surface; that\u2019s okay. Bake for about 35 minutes, until the topping is golden brown.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/raspberry-jam-bars.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the jam bars cool in the baking dish on a rack for about 15 minutes. Using the foil overhang, lift the bars out of the pan and onto the countertop. Pull the foil away from the sides to prevent sticking, and then let sit until completely cool, a few hours. Cut into 16 bars. Cover the bars with foil and store at room temperature for up to two days. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/raspberry-jam-bars.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> These bars can be frozen for up to 2 months. Before serving, remove the bars from the container and let them come to room temperature. This results in a neater, more compact egg shape and a slightly better texture. However, if you don't mind the appearance of the eggs or are not concerned about achieving a perfectly rounded shape, you can skip this step to save time and effort. The taste and overall quality of the poached egg will still be good without straining; it's purely an aesthetic preference.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/perfect-poached-eggs.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead Instructions: Immediately after poaching the eggs, transfer them to a bowl of ice water. This stops the cooking process instantly and helps preserve their delicate texture. Once cooled, store the poached eggs in the ice water in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours. When ready to serve the eggs, reheat by bringing a pan of water to a gentle simmer\u2014do not let it boil as high heat can cause the eggs to become rubbery or break apart. Using a slotted spoon, place the poached eggs in the simmering water for 30 seconds to 1 minute, just until they are warmed through. Mix on low speed to combine. Add the water and \u00bd cup of the olive oil; mix on low speed until the dough comes together, then turn the speed up to medium-low and continue to knead for 5 to 6 minutes, until the dough becomes soft and slightly tacky. It should stick to the bottom of the bowl a bit. If the dough seems too wet, sprinkle with a few tablespoons of flour, and turn the mixer back on to knead it briefly to combine.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the dough to a clean, lightly floured surface (it helps to flour your hands, too). Knead by hand briefly until the dough comes together into a smooth ball. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Coat the inside of a large bowl with about 1 teaspoon of olive oil. Place the dough in the bowl, flipping once so that both the top and bottom are lightly slicked with oil. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and put it in a warm, draft-free spot until the dough has doubled in size, 1 to 2 hours. (The warmer the spot, the faster it will rise.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Coat a 13\" x 18\" rimmed baking sheet with \u00bc cup of olive oil. (It will seem like a lot, but that's what makes the bottom crispy.) Plop the dough onto the prepared pan and begin pressing it out with your hands to fit the size of the pan. Turn the dough over once to coat both sides with olive oil. Continue to stretch the dough to fit the pan. Once the dough is stretched, spread your fingers out and make impressions almost all the way through the dough (don't poke holes, just press down to the bottom of the pan). Cover the pan with plastic wrap and place in the warm, draft-free spot until the dough has puffed up and doubled in size, about 1 hour. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the dough is rising a second time, preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F. Set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sprinkle the top of the focaccia dough with the remaining \u00be teaspoon kosher salt and rosemary, then lightly drizzle about 1 tablespoon of olive oil on top so it pools in the indentations. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Remove the focaccia from the oven and let it cool in the pan on a wire rack for about 15 minutes. Transfer the focaccia to a cutting board and slice into squares. Drizzle a touch more oil on top before serving, if desired.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> Focaccia is best eaten freshly baked but it can be made 1 day ahead of time, if necessary. For best results, wrap the focaccia in aluminum foil and place in a sealed plastic bag at room temperature. Reheat, wrapped in foil, in a 350\u00b0F oven until just warmed through, about 10 minutes. The focaccia can also be made ahead and frozen.  To freeze, cut it into portions, wrap in plastic wrap and then foil and freeze for up to 3 months. To reheat the focaccia, remove the plastic wrap and re-wrap it in the foil. Heat it in a 350\u00b0F oven for 10 minutes or until heated through.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> Active dry yeast may be used instead of instant/rapid-rise yeast, however, the dough will take longer to rise. To give active dry yeast a boost, you can add it to the warm water in the recipe, let it sit until frothy, about 10 minutes, and then proceed with the recipe.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rosemary-focaccia.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}], "recipeIngredient": ["5 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off with a knife, plus more for kneading", "1 tablespoon sugar", "1 packet (2\u00bc teaspoons) instant/rapid-rise yeast (see note)", "1 tablespoon + \u00be teaspoon kosher salt, divided", "1\u00be cup warm water", "\u00be cup extra virgin olive oil, divided, plus more for oiling the bowl and drizzling on top", "1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary, from several sprigs"], "recipeYield": "24 ({2\u00bd-inch x 3-inch|6 x 8-cm}) foccacia squares (serves 10-12)", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Focaccia-1200x1441.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Focaccia-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Focaccia-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Focaccia-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/anne-burrell/focaccia-recipe.html\" target=\"_blank\">Anne Burrell</a>", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.96, "ratingCount": "193"}, "datePublished": "2019-07-16T21:19:46-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Potluck, Yeast", "recipeCuisine": "Italian", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

If those aren\u2019t available, individual slider buns are also suitable. <br/><br/>If using individual buns, you can still recreate the convenience of a sheet. Cool, then slip off the skins and mash the garlic with a fork.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-guacamole.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the avocados in half lengthwise. Carefully strike the pits with the edge of a sharp knife, then twist and loosen to remove. Holding each avocado half in the palm of your hand, use a butter knife to cut a grid in the flesh. Use a spoon to scoop the cubes of flesh out of the skin and into a medium bowl. Add the roasted garlic, tomato, cilantro, jalape\u00f1o, lime juice, and salt. Coarsely mash everything together, being careful to leave some chunks. Taste and add more salt and lime juice if desired (you can also add some of the jalape\u00f1o core if you want more heat; just add it slowly). Transfer to a bowl and serve with tortilla chips. If not serving immediately, place a piece of plastic wrap directly on the surface of the guacamole. Refrigerate for up to two hours; bring to room temperature before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-guacamole.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "*To prepare the jalape\u00f1o, use a small knife to slice straight down along one side, removing just the flesh. Turn the pepper and repeat with the remaining sides. All of the seeds and most of the veins -- the extra hot stuff -- should remain in the core. Mince the flesh and reserve the core in case you want to add more heat to your guacamole. Try to minimize contact with the seeds and be sure to wash your hands well after cutting; definitely do not touch your eyes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-guacamole.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3 large garlic cloves, unpeeled", "3 ripe large avocados", "1 small tomato, seeded, juiced and diced (about \u2153 cup)", "\u00bc cup coarsely chopped cilantro", "2 tablespoons jalape\u00f1o pepper, stemmed, seeded and minced (you'll need one pepper)**", "1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, plus more if desired (you'll need about \u00bd lime)", "\u00bd teaspoon salt, plus more to taste"], "recipeYield": "4 to 6", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2010/05/Roasted-Garlic-Guacamole-1200x1514.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2010/05/Roasted-Garlic-Guacamole-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2010/05/Roasted-Garlic-Guacamole-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2010/05/Roasted-Garlic-Guacamole-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from Rick Bayless in <a href=\"http://www.eatingwell.com/\" target=\"_blank\"><strong><em>Eating Well</em></strong></a>", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.95, "ratingCount": "20"}, "datePublished": "2019-04-27T09:10:27-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Avocados, Bbq, Cinco de Mayo, July 4th, Labor Day, Memorial Day, Peppers, Picnic, Potluck", "recipeCuisine": "Mexican, Tex-Mex", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

["https://www.onceuponachef.com/about-jenn-segal", "chefadmin"]}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#faq-question-1700317733353", "position": 1, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#faq-question-1700317733353", "name": "Q: Can I use all butter or all shortening in my pie crust?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "A: Yes, you can use all butter or all shortening, but the texture and flavor will differ. All butter will give a richer flavor and potentially more flakiness due to its water content, but it can be harder to work with as it melts faster. All shortening, on the other hand, is easier to handle and helps the crust hold its shape better but will lack the delicious flavor that butter provides.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#faq-question-1700317845266", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#faq-question-1700317845266", "name": "Q: Why should the butter and shortening be cold when making pie crust?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "A: Keeping the butter and shortening cold is crucial for achieving a flaky pie crust. When cold, these fats don't mix completely with the flour, creating small pockets in the dough. As the crust bakes, the fat pockets steam, resulting in the desired flakiness. Additionally, cold fats are less likely to be overworked into the dough, which can prevent the crust from becoming tough. Working with cold ingredients also makes the dough easier to handle and roll out.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}]}, {"@context": "https://slickstream.com", "@graph": [{"@type": "Plugin", "version": "3.0.1"}, {"@type": "Site", "name": "Once Upon a Chef", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com", "description": "Tested &amp; Perfected Recipes", "atomUrl": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/feed/atom", "rtl": false}, {"@type": "WebPage", "@id": 27429, "isFront": false, "isHome": false, "isCategory": false, "isTag": false, "isSingular": true, "date": "2024-11-24T08:20:11-05:00", "modified": "2024-09-25T12:27:20-04:00", "title": "Perfect Pie Crust", "pageType": "post", "postType": "post", "featured_image": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/11/Pie_Crust_Recipe-scaled.jpg", "author": "Jennifer Segal", "categories": [{"@id": 36, "parent": 14, "slug": "cakes", "name": "Cakes, Pies &amp  Tarts", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 14, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Dessert"}, {"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 2, "slug": "recipes", "name": "Recipes"}]}, {"@id": 14, "parent": 2, "slug": "desserts", "name": "Dessert", "parents": [{"@type": "CategoryParent", "@id": 2, "slug": "recipes", "name": "Recipes"}]}, {"@id": 863, "parent": 0, "slug": "how-to", "name": "How To &amp  Resources", "parents": []}], "tags": ["Christmas", "Thanksgiving"], "taxonomies": [{"name": "ouac_cuisine", "label": "Cuisines", "description": "", "terms": [{"@id": 1128, "name": "American", "slug": "american"}]}]}]}, {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-27429", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal "}, "name": "Perfect Pie Crust", "description": "Learn how to make the perfect pie crust with this easy recipe. Pulse until you have coarse crumbs with lots of pea-sized clumps of butter and shortening within, 15 to 20 one-second pulses.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the water and pulse until the mixture is just evenly moistened and very crumbly, 7 to 10 one-second pulses. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dump the crumbly dough out onto a work surface and gather it into a ball.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pat the dough into a 5-inch disc and wrap it in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 45 minutes or up to 3 days to rest.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Take the dough out of the refrigerator and dust your work surface lightly with flour. Place the dough on top and sprinkle a little flour over the dough. Use your hands to quickly knead the dough into a soft and malleable disc (don\u2019t overwork it; you want it just supple enough to roll).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll the dough, turning it frequently and adding more flour as necessary so it doesn\u2019t stick, into a 13-inch circle.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fold the dough into quarters without creasing it and transfer it to a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gently fit the dough into the pan, easing it inwards rather than stretching it outwards. Don\u2019t worry if it tears, just patch it right back up.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Trim the edges to \u00bd inch beyond the lip of the pie pan, if necessary. Turn the edges under to create a rim on the crust (you can use the scraps to patch in any thin areas); then press the rim against the lip of the pan, forming it into an even edge as you go. Using your fingers, crimp the rim. Place the crust in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, and then proceed with your pie recipe. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If your crust requires blind baking: Preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F. Remove the crust from the refrigerator and cover with a piece of parchment paper. Fill the crust at least halfway full with dried beans or pie weights. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the crust is set. Carefully remove the parchment and weights. If the recipe requires a fully baked crust (such as for a custard pie), return the crust to the oven and bake for an additional 5 to 10 minutes, or until the bottom is golden and cooked through. For recipes requiring further baking, proceed as directed.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions:  The pie crust dough can be frozen for up to 3 months after you\u2019ve formed it into a disc. Wrap it tightly in a layer of plastic wrap and a layer of foil. Before using, thaw the dough in the fridge overnight and then proceed with the recipe.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you don\u2019t have a food processor, you can mix the dough by hand. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking powder until well combined. Add the cold butter and shortening, and use a pastry cutter, two knives, or your fingers to cut the fats into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs with some pea-sized clumps. Drizzle the cold water over the mixture, one tablespoon at a time, and toss with a fork until the dough just comes together. Avoid overmixing; the dough should still be crumbly but hold together when pinched. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/pie-crust-recipe.html#fv-recipe-step-13"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00bd cups  all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled with a knife", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "\u215b teaspoon baking powder", "6 tablespoons very cold unsalted butter, sliced into \u00bc-inch pieces", "3 tablespoons very cold vegetable shortening, in 3 pieces", "4 tablespoons very cold water"], "recipeYield": "1 9-inch deep dish pie crust", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/11/Pie_Crust_Recipe-1200x1389.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/11/Pie_Crust_Recipe-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/11/Pie_Crust_Recipe-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/11/Pie_Crust_Recipe-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.52, "ratingCount": "60"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-24T08:20:11-05:00", "keywords": "Christmas, Thanksgiving", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "How To &amp; Resources"}]

"recipeIngredient": ["3  large egg whites, (at room temperature)", "1/8 teaspoon cream of tartar", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "\u00be cup sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon vanilla extract", "\u00be cup semisweet chocolate chips"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set two racks in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 250\u00b0F (120\u00b0C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "name": "Set two racks in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 250\u00b0F (120\u00b0C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-meringue-cookies.html#wprm-recipe-77051-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the egg whites, cream of tartar and salt on medium-high speed (or high speed if using a hand mixer) until the egg whites are frothy, white, and hold a soft peak when the whisk is lifted out of the bowl, about 45 seconds. Continue to beat on medium-high speed, adding the sugar very gradually, taking about 2 minutes to add it all. Beat for 4 to 5 minutes more, until the meringue is glossy and stiff, with a shaving cream-like consistency. Beat in the vanilla extract. Set 3 tablespoons of the chocolate chips aside. Add the remaining chocolate chips to the meringue and fold with a rubber spatula to combine.", "name": "In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the egg whites, cream of tartar and salt on medium-high speed (or high speed if using a hand mixer) until the egg whites are frothy, white, and hold a soft peak when the whisk is lifted out of the bowl, about 45 seconds. Continue to beat on medium-high speed, adding the sugar very gradually, taking about 2 minutes to add it all. Beat for 4 to 5 minutes more, until the meringue is glossy and stiff, with a shaving cream-like consistency. Beat in the vanilla extract. Set 3 tablespoons of the chocolate chips aside. Add the remaining chocolate chips to the meringue and fold with a rubber spatula to combine.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-meringue-cookies.html#wprm-recipe-77051-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use two soup spoons to drop 1\u00bd-in (4-cm) mounds of meringue onto the prepared baking sheets about 2 in (5 cm) apart. Dot the meringues with the reserved chocolate chips, pressing them into the meringue just slightly.  Place the meringues in the oven and bake for 30 minutes. Turn the oven off and let the meringues cool in the oven for 30 minutes more. Let the meringues finish cooling on the baking sheets on the countertop for about 1 hour, or until the chocolate chips are no longer soft. The cookies are best enjoyed fresh on the day they are made, but leftovers can be stored in an airtight container for several days. Take care when stacking the cookies; they are fragile.", "name": "Use two soup spoons to drop 1\u00bd-in (4-cm) mounds of meringue onto the prepared baking sheets about 2 in (5 cm) apart. Dot the meringues with the reserved chocolate chips, pressing them into the meringue just slightly.  Place the meringues in the oven and bake for 30 minutes. Turn the oven off and let the meringues cool in the oven for 30 minutes more. Let the meringues finish cooling on the baking sheets on the countertop for about 1 hour, or until the chocolate chips are no longer soft. The cookies are best enjoyed fresh on the day they are made, but leftovers can be stored in an airtight container for several days. Take care when stacking the cookies; they are fragile.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-meringue-cookies.html#wprm-recipe-77051-step-0-2"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.8", "ratingCount": "49", "reviewCount": "9"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "I\u2019m in Denver, made these with zero changes, and they turned out perfect.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Theresa"}, "datePublished": "2025-07-13"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Brought these to a potluck and they were a hit. "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/irish-cream-tiramisu.html#faq-question-1713532869865", "name": "Should I be concerned about using raw eggs?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Like <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-mousse.html\">chocolate mousse</a>, tiramisu is made with raw eggs. If that is a concern, try to find pasteurized eggs. Pasteurized eggs have been briefly exposed to heat to destroy any potential bacteria. Whole Foods usually carries them but call your local store to be sure before making a special trip. (Note: eating raw eggs is not advisable for pregnant women, babies, the elderly, or anyone with a compromised immune system.)", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/irish-cream-tiramisu.html#faq-question-1713533510540", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/irish-cream-tiramisu.html#faq-question-1713533510540", "name": "What is superfine sugar?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Superfine sugar is a type of granulated sugar with a very fine texture. It's finer than regular granulated sugar but not as fine as powdered sugar. Superfine sugar dissolves more quickly than regular granulated sugar, making it ideal for use in recipes where you want a smooth texture, such as meringues (like this <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pavlova.html\">pavlova</a>), cocktails (like these <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/mojitos-2.html\">mojitos</a>), and tender cookies (like these <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/nutty-jam-thumbprints.html\">nutty jam thumbprints</a>). If you don't have superfine sugar, you can make your own -- just process regular granulated sugar in a food processor for 30 seconds until fine.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}]}, Repeat with another layer of soaked cookies, then top with the remaining mascarpone mixture. Why do you recommend a different approach?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Marinating chicken in a mix of spices and oil rather than BBQ sauce is key to achieving that authentic BBQ flavor. Spices penetrate the meat more effectively, seasoning it throughout, whereas BBQ sauce tends to sit on the surface. Moreover, BBQ sauce contains tons of sugar that can burn easily when exposed to heat, leading to a burnt exterior before the chicken fully cooks inside.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bbq-chicken.html#faq-question-1707573258171", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bbq-chicken.html#faq-question-1707573258171", "name": "Can I make BBQ in the oven?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, making BBQ chicken in the oven is a fantastic alternative, especially when grilling isn't an option. Start by preheating your broiler and positioning the oven rack so that the chicken will be about 6 inches from the heat source. Place the chicken on foil-lined baking sheet for easy cleanup. Broil the chicken for about 5 minutes on each side, then brush generously with BBQ sauce and broil for an additional 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until the sauce is caramelized and the chicken is fully cooked.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bbq-chicken.html#faq-question-1707573418876", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/bbq-chicken.html#faq-question-1707573418876", "name": "Can I use bone-in, skin-on chicken pieces instead?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, to grill whole chicken pieces, preheat the grill to medium heat (about 350-375\u00b0F). Clean and oil the cooking grate. Place the chicken, skin side up, on the cooler side of the grill and cook, covered, turning and moving occasionally to prevent burning and flare-ups, for 35 to 40 minutes. If the skin is not yet crispy, move the chicken, skin side down, to the hotter side of the grill; cook, keeping a close watch to prevent burning, until the skin is crisp, a few minutes.", "description": "Nothing says summer like simple grilled salmon topped with a creamy cucumber salad\u2014 the ultimate no-fuss meal!", "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT30M",
