cucumber in half and then slice each half down the middle lengthwise. Use the tip of a teaspoon to scoop out the center seeds. Cut each half into thin slices and place in a colander along with the red onion slices. Toss with salt and let sit in the sink for at least 30 minutes, until the water drains out.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grilled-salmon-with-creamy-cucumber-dill-salad.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the meantime, make the dressing: combine the sour cream, mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, dill, garlic, sugar and black pepper in a medium bowl and mix well.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grilled-salmon-with-creamy-cucumber-dill-salad.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the cucumbers and onions are ready, release any excess water by tapping the colander on the base of the sink, then use a large wad of paper towels to pat the vegetables dry. Add to the dressing and toss well. Cover and chill until ready to serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grilled-salmon-with-creamy-cucumber-dill-salad.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Clean the grill rack, then brush with oil. Close the lid and let return to temperature. Rub the salmon with olive oil and season generously with kosher salt and pepper. Place the fillets skin side down and grill until golden brown and slightly charred, 4 to 5 minutes (resist the urge to peek or flip early; when fillets are nicely seared on the first side, they should release easily). Flip the fillets over and continue grilling until done, 2 to 3 minutes. Let cool slightly, remove the skin if desired, and serve with the cold cucumber-dill salad piled over top or alongside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/grilled-salmon-with-creamy-cucumber-dill-salad.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}], "recipeIngredient": ["4 (6-oz) salmon fillets, skin on", "1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil", "\u00be teaspoon kosher salt", "\u00bd teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "1 English cucumber (also called hothouse cucumber)", "\u2153 cup finely sliced red onion, from one small red onion", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "\u00bc cup plus 2 tablespoons sour cream", "3 tablespoons mayonnaise, best quality such as Hellmann's or Duke's", "2 tablespoons white wine vinegar", "\u00bc cup chopped fresh dill", "1 clove garlic, minced", "\u00bd teaspoon sugar", " Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeYield": "4", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/08/Grilled-Salmon-11-1200x1500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/08/Grilled-Salmon-11-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/08/Grilled-Salmon-11-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/08/Grilled-Salmon-11-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.96, "ratingCount": "78"}, "datePublished": "2023-08-22T08:16:48-04:00", "keywords": "Grill, Salmon, Spring, Summer, White Wine Vinegar", "recipeCuisine": "Middle Eastern", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"Heat\u00a0broiler to high and broil one of the jalape\u00f1os on a heatproof pan. Cook, turning occasionally, until the jalape\u00f1o is completely charred. (Alternatively, if you have a gas stove, turn a burner to the highest setting and set your pepper directly on the flame. Use a pair of tongs to turn the pepper until the skin is completely blackened.) Place the blackened pepper in a small bowl, cover tightly with plastic wrap and let sit for 15 minutes. When cool enough to handle, use a paper towel to wipe off the charred skin. Halve, seed devein and dice the roasted jalape\u00f1o. Then halve, seed, and dice the remaining raw jalape\u00f1o.  (If you touch the seeds of the jalape\u00f1o, just be sure to wash your hands well and avoid touching your eyes.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/green-pea-guacamole.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of a small food processor, pur\u00e9e the peas with the roasted jalape\u00f1o, raw jalape\u00f1o and cilantro. Scrape down the sides of the bowl, then beat in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl again. With the mixer on low speed, beat in a third of the flour mixture, then half of the milk mixture. Beat in another third of the flour mixture, then the remaining milk mixture, followed by the remaining flour mixture, scraping the bowl as necessary. Add the flour-dusted blueberries to the batter and, using a spatula, fold until evenly combined. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-blueberry-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Add more confectioners' sugar or lemon juice as necessary to make a thick but pourable glaze (it should be a little thicker than you'd think, about the consistency of molasses or honey). Spoon the glaze over the top of the cake, letting it drip down the sides. Let the glaze set for 10 to 15 minutes before serving. Slice with a serrated knife. The cake will keep on the countertop for up to 3 days; store in a covered container or wrap in plastic wrap. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-blueberry-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The cake can be frozen (without the glaze) for up to 3 months. "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Spritz Cookies", "description": "Press, bake, decorate! Easily whip up over 6 dozen buttery spritz cookies\u2014with no dough chilling required, they're the perfect fuss-free and festive addition to your holiday cookie trays.", "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1 cookie", "calories": "39", "fatContent": "2 g", "carbohydrateContent": "4 g", "proteinContent": "0 g", "saturatedFatContent": "", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "2 g", "fiberContent": "0 g", "sodiumContent": "15 mg", "cholesterolContent": "8 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set two racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or beaters, beat the butter, sugar, and salt on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add the egg, almond extract, and vanilla extract and beat until combined, about 30 seconds. Add the flour and mix on low speed until combined. Initially, the dough will appear crumbly, but it will eventually come together. If you wish to color the dough, add a few drops of food coloring at this stage and continue mixing until the color is evenly distributed.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before you begin, ensure your baking sheets are at room temperature. Do not grease them or line them with parchment paper, as the cookie press won\u2019t work effectively on surfaces that are warm, parchment-lined, or greased. Follow the directions provided by your cookie press manufacturer for attaching a decorative plate. Load the cookie press with some of the dough. To press out the cookies, hold the cookie press upright and position it so that it is directly touching the baking sheet. Firmly press out the cookies, spacing them about 1\u00bd inches apart.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, rotating the pans from top to bottom and front to back halfway through, or until the cookies are just starting to turn golden around the edges. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Repeat with the remaining cookie dough, making sure to cool the baking sheets between batches (as mentioned above, the cookie press will not work on warm baking sheets).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To decorate the cookies, lightly dab, drizzle, or brush a small amount of corn syrup over each cookie. Then, either gently dip them into the sprinkles or sprinkle the decorations directly over the cookies. Remember, a little corn syrup goes a long way, so use it very sparingly.   ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The cookie dough can be made in advance and stored in the refrigerator, tightly wrapped in plastic, for up to 3 days. Allow it to reach room temperature before pressing and baking. The baked cookies can be stored at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 3 days. For freezing, first cool the cookies completely, then store them in an airtight container, separating layers with parchment paper, for up to 3 months. Thaw them at room temperature before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note on Food Coloring: For optimal results in coloring your spritz cookie dough, I recommend using gel food coloring. It's more concentrated than its liquid counterpart, allowing you to achieve rich colors with less product and without altering the dough's consistency (excess moisture from liquid coloring can impact the dough\u2019s ability to maintain its shape). Gel food coloring is available in the baking aisle of most grocery stores. Remember, a little goes a long way; start with a small amount and add gradually to reach your desired hue.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spritz-cookies.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature", "\u00be cup  sugar", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "1 large egg ", "\u00bd teaspoon almond extract", "1 teaspoon  vanilla extract", "2\u00bc  cups all purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled off ", " Food coloring (optional; see note)", " Light corn syrup or glaze icing", " Sparkling sugar, nonpareils, or sprinkles", " Cookie press"], "recipeYield": "84 cookies", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/spritz-cookies-1200x917.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/spritz-cookies-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/spritz-cookies-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/12/spritz-cookies-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "8"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-28T06:22:37-05:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

together the egg yolks, oil, water and vanilla.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or beaters, combine the flour, \u00be cup of the sugar, and the baking powder; mix on low speed for 20 seconds to combine. Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and beat (start slow to combine then increase to medium for stand mixer/medium-high for hand mixer) for one minute to aerate it slightly. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula and beat for just a few seconds more. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a clean, dry mixing bowl, combine the egg whites and salt. Using the whisk attachment or beaters, whip the egg whites (on medium speed for a stand mixer/medium-high speed for a hand mixer) until they are white, foamy, and beginning to hold a very soft peak, 40 to 60 seconds. Increase the speed (medium-high for stand mixer/high for hand mixer) and gradually add the remaining \u00bc cup of sugar in a slow stream. Continue whipping the mixture until it is shiny and holds stiff peaks, 2 to 3 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a large rubber spatula, add \u00bc of the egg white mixture into the batter and mix thoroughly. Add the remaining egg whites to the lightened batter and gently fold until the batter is uniform. Do not over-mix. Scrape the batter into an ungreased 9x13-in glass or ceramic baking dish (do not use metal) and smooth the top (note that it's very important NOT to grease the pan). Bake the cake for 45 to 50 minutes, or until it is set and golden.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the cake sit on the stovetop for 1 to 2 minutes, until the cake settles (you want it to deflate just slightly, so that the top of the cake is level with rim of the pan), then invert four glasses onto the countertop and invert the cake pan onto them, positioning one in each corner of the pan. (A chiffon cake needs to hang upside down to cool or it will collapse and fall.)  Let cool for 1 hour.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the cake has cooled, flip it over and run a sharp, thin-bladed knife around the edge of the pan to loosen the cake from the sides. Poke holes in the cake with a skewer or point of a small, sharp knife at \u00bd-in intervals. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the soaking liquid: in a large bowl, whisk together the evaporated milk, sweetened condensed milk, heavy cream and rum. Slowly pour or spoon the soaking liquid over the cake, tilting the pan every so often to help it absorb evenly. Be patient: this process takes about 10 minutes. If the cake is slow to absorb, run a knife around the edges of the cake again and poke a few more holes. Don't worry if it looks like a mess; it all gets covered with the glaze anyway. Place the cake in the refrigerator, uncovered, to chill for at least 8 hours or overnight. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the cake has chilled, make the glaze: in a medium microwave-safe bowl, combine the dulce de leche, rum and water. (Note: If you want a really boozy cake, change the proportions in the glaze to 3 tablespoons water and 2 tablespoons rum). Heat for 30 to 60 seconds in the microwave to soften the dulce de leche, then whisk until completely smooth. Let the mixture cool to room temperature, then spread over the cake, swirling artistically with an offset spatula or butter knife. Place the cake back in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Serve with fresh fruit, if desired.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tres-leches-cake-with-dulce-de-leche-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3  large egg yolks", "\u2153 cup vegetable oil", "\u00bd cup water", "2 teaspoons vanilla extract", "1\u00bd cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off with a knife", "1 cup sugar, divided", "2 teaspoons baking powder", "5 large egg whites", "\u215b teaspoon salt", "1 (12-oz) can evaporated milk", "1 (14-oz) can sweetened condensed milk", "\u00bc cup plus 2 tablespoons heavy cream", "3 tablespoons dark rum", "1  (13-oz) can dulce de leche, preferably Nestle", "1 tablespoon  dark rum", "\u00bc cup water"], "recipeYield": "Twenty-four 2-inch squares", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Tres-Leches-Cake-with-Dulce-de-Leche-Glaze-1200x1680.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Tres-Leches-Cake-with-Dulce-de-Leche-Glaze-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Tres-Leches-Cake-with-Dulce-de-Leche-Glaze-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Tres-Leches-Cake-with-Dulce-de-Leche-Glaze-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from Nick Malgieri", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.76, "ratingCount": "62"}, "datePublished": "2019-04-30T12:21:18-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Boozy, Christmas, Cinco de Mayo, Dulce De Leche, Evaporated Milk, July 4th, Labor Day, Memorial Day, Sweetened Condensed Milk", "recipeCuisine": "Mexican, Tex-Mex", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Set aside to cool.", "name": "Place the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl and cook in the microwave in 20-second intervals, stirring in between, until about three-quarters of the way melted. Stir, allowing the residual heat in the bowl to melt the remaining chocolate completely. (If necessary, place the chocolate back in microwave for a few seconds.) Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-cupcakes.html#wprm-recipe-77173-step-1-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a food processor, process the butter, sugar, cocoa powder and salt until smooth, about 30 seconds, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Add the corn syrup and vanilla and process until just combined, 5 to 10 seconds. Scrape down the sides of the bowl, then add the lukewarm chocolate and pulse until smooth and creamy, 10 to 15 seconds. Do not overmix. The frosting can be used immediately or held at room temperature for up to 3 hours.", "name": "In a food processor, process the butter, sugar, cocoa powder and salt until smooth, about 30 seconds, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Add the corn syrup and vanilla and process until just combined, 5 to 10 seconds. Scrape down the sides of the bowl, then add the lukewarm chocolate and pulse until smooth and creamy, 10 to 15 seconds. Do not overmix. ", "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "580", "fatContent": "33g", "carbohydrateContent": "30g", "proteinContent": "45g", "saturatedFatContent": "7g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "20g", "fiberContent": "4g", "sodiumContent": "1565mg", "cholesterolContent": "195g"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If using iceberg lettuce: fill a large bowl with cold water. Place the head of lettuce on a cutting board; cut off the stem, then cut around the inner core of the lettuce and remove (do not cut all the way through the lettuce; just deep enough to remove the core). Discard the flimsy, ragged outer leaves and then place the head of lettuce in the bowl of water. Gently pull apart the leaves, then place them on a paper towel to dry. Cut any large leaves in half. Chill the lettuce cups in refrigerator until ready to serve. (If using butter lettuce, you won't have any issues pulling apart the leaves so this step is not necessary.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/thai-minced-chicken-lettuce-cups.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the oil in large saut\u00e9 pan over medium heat. Add the onion and ginger and cook, stirring frequently, until soft, 4-5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute more.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/thai-minced-chicken-lettuce-cups.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the ground chicken and turn the heat up to high. Cook, breaking up the meat with a wooden spoon, until partially cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add the soy sauce, fish sauce, brown sugar, lime zest, lime juice and red pepper flakes and continue cooking, stirring frequently to break up the meat, until the chicken is cooked through, 5-6 minutes more. Off the heat, stir in the scallions, cilantro, mint and nuts. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Spoon into lettuce cups and serve with optional garnishes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/thai-minced-chicken-lettuce-cups.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Check out easy guidance on how to peel, grate, and chop fresh ginger <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/how-to-peel-and-grate-ginger.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/thai-minced-chicken-lettuce-cups.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The meat mixture can be frozen in an airtight container for up to 3 months and reheated in the microwave om on the stovetop until hot. Drizzle with the oil and sprinkle evenly with the salt and pepper. Flip the squash halves so they are cut side down. Roast for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the squash is golden brown underneath and tender when pierced with a fork. Place the pot back over low heat and cook, stirring constantly with the tongs, until the sauce is the consistency of a thin cream sauce, a few minutes. Add more of the reserved pasta water to thin the sauce only if necessary. Be careful at this stage: if the sauce gets too hot, it will start to clump up and stick to the pot and tongs. Once the sauce is the right consistency, immediately transfer the pasta to bowls and serve. (Alternatively, use a ladle to transfer 2 to 3 cups of the soup to a blender. Remove the center knob so steam can escape. Hold a paper towel or kitchen towel over the opening to prevent splatters. Pur\u00e9e until smooth and return the blended soup to the pot.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/mulligatawny.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the cooked chicken and 1 tablespoon lime juice, and heat until warmed through. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt, more lime juice, and cayenne pepper, if desired. Serve the soup generously sprinkled with fresh chopped cilantro, with lime wedges on the side.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/mulligatawny.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> The soup will thicken as it sits. Add more chicken broth to thin it out if necessary.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/mulligatawny.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The soup can be frozen for up to 3 months in an airtight container. Reheat it on the stovetop over medium-low heat until hot. (The soup will thicken up when frozen, so you may need to add a bit of broth when reheating.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/mulligatawny.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons vegetable oil", "1 tablespoon garam masala (or substitute curry powder)", "1 cup diced carrots, from 2 to 3 carrots", "1 cup chopped yellow onion, from 1 medium onion", "\u00bd cup finely chopped celery, from 2 stalks", "1 tart-yet-sweet apple, such as Honeycrisp or Fuji, peeled and finely chopped", "6 cups chicken broth, best quality such as Swanson", "1 cup canned unsweetened coconut milk ", "1\u2153 cups red lentils", "Scant \u00bd teaspoon salt", "2 cups shredded cooked chicken, from a store-bought rotisserie chicken or leftovers ", "1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, plus lime wedges for serving ", "Pinch cayenne pepper (optional)", "\u00bd cup chopped fresh cilantro, for serving"], "recipeYield": "4 to 6", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/10/mulligatawny-soup-1200x1508.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/10/mulligatawny-soup-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/10/mulligatawny-soup-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/10/mulligatawny-soup-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from Sara Moulton's <a href=\"https://amzn.to/48YkRuk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener sponsored\">Everyday Family Dinners</a>", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.88, "ratingCount": "94"}, "datePublished": "2024-01-22T15:18:37-05:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Apples, Carrots, Celery, Coconut Milk, Lentils, Limes, Rotisserie Chicken", "recipeCuisine": "Indian", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]
